Reviews.Title: “Not to much sleep”
Reviews.Author: Zdenca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located. It's right next to the Vondel park and the city centre is not far away. We walked all the time. Our room 232 - very soft bed, quite tiny room. There is a glass bathroom and toilet in the room, so it feels strange. Next door were some noisy girls and you can really hear every word. We didn't pay for breakfast cause it's expensive at the hotel. This room was situated to the street - it's not busy street but you could hear some noise made by public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Karina C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location if you like to be in the prettier part of town, handful of resteraunts within 5 minute walk and all attractions within 10 minute walk or tram

Reviews.Title: “Nice, relaxed atmosphere, away from main centre”
Reviews.Author: 777pj777
Reviews.Content: Recently refurbished boutique style hotel located by the Vondelpark. The room was nice, if a little small but it did make good use of the available space. Location is good as long as you don't mind not being in the city centre - the vondelpark is great just to wander around, although be careful of the bikes! Food was nice although ordering room service was tricky as there were no menus! Also, could not alter the room temperature for love nor money - it seemed to be missing a remote control. Overall good with some minor annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel split into two buildings!”
Reviews.Author: John9991
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a long way from Centraal Station so jump on tram 2 and get off at the Emmastraat stop. As you get off the tram turn left (not right as some websites say) and the hotel is a few hundred metres on your right) Beds were not changed and a very poor effort to make them up, looked like the cleaners couldnt be bothered! Some rooms are up on side of the hotel and some are on the other side through a tunnel walkway. The check in staff watched us get in the wrong elevator after check in and never even said that our room was in the other side of the hotel. Ten mins later only bumping into someone did I realise the hotel was split into two buildings. Useless... The sink is in the bedroom, outside the the toilet and shower. Very strange. The toilet is open at the top and bottom and shielded by a glass screen which doesnt reach the roof or floor, so you can smell everything your partner does, not nice! :) Park Plaza took the payment off my card, despite booking.com saying this wouldnt happen. They then refused my cash payment on arrival by telling lies that booking.com had taken the payment and they couldnt refund it back onto my card?! The reason I hate this is that the exchange rate by my bank is disgusting and incurs all sorts of charges. Wrip off.....

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Erik E
Reviews.Content: This is the second time IÂ´ve stayed at this hotel and IÂ´ve been satisfied with both stays. The check in went fast and the receptionist gave us all the information we needed. The room is very clean and we had everything that we needed. The hotel is a 10-15 minutes walk from Leidseplein, but this is a nice walk and on the road can you also visit the Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum. Since we just stayed for one night, didnÂ´t we use all of the facilities at the hotel, but can recommend this hotel if you are going to Amsterdam. Will use this hotel again if I going back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha F
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a birthday trip to the dam and was pleased at the standard of the hotel, we booked via easyjet so great value for money! we were not expecting a great standard due to the great location and the great price but were amazed at the funky decor lovely clean rooms, and the very friendly staff. The bar is pretty amazing a must for a night cap! very good location trams run near by and the lovley vondlepark is next door which is a must see! excellent! cant wait to visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lorraibenn
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Park Palza, Vondelpark. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. Rooms were very comfortable, however looking at the photo's on tripadvisor it seems that they differ in decor and size. We had room 45 which was spacious and warm, our friends had room 11 which was much smaller and very cold. They asked for an extra duvet which was provided. Breakfasts were very good with plenty of choice but the food wasn't kept very hot. On departure day we were able to leave our bags in a secure room as our flight home was late at night. We thought that the location of the hotel was very good, it was about a 20 minute walk through the Vondelpark to reach the Leidsplein but it was no problem. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* but great location!”
Reviews.Author: aneta_ch
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a 4* rating, which it probably shouldn't have. The rooms are rather small, and very basic! and don't get tricked into the 'premium standard' room classification - it's just a basic room. It was however well taken care of, cleaned every day, the towels were changed, as a welcome there were 2 large bottles of water and fruit bowl. It's in a very good location, with minute walk to lovely huge park, fantastic for morning walks, but also within minutes walk of the Museum Square and Leidseplain, which is great for small bars and clubs. Even though the street it's on is rather quiet and residential, you are within a walking distance to so many places it feels like you are in the very centre of the city! The hotel has very friendly and helpful staff with whatever it is that you need. All in all it was a fabulous stay and good value for money! I would certainly recommend staying in that hotel, and would definitely go back there again should I be stopping by in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in a lovely quiet location but toilet arrangements spoilt it.”
Reviews.Author: Madcow4985
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Plaza near Vondelpark last weekend and were fairly underwhelmed with the hotel. As we got it at a reasonable price I can't complain too much about the worn looking carpets and wash basin that needed refurbishing (or chucking out!). But I think what really changed the hotel from being a nice, good value hotel in a lovely location to somewhere I know I will never return to was the toilet arrangement. The toilet and shower were behind a glass partition, which didn't reach the ceiling. Not great! I can cope with being on display when on the loo, but hated the idea of stinking out the bedroom. We took to using the downstairs loo if we needed to make a smell, and it seemed quite a few other people were doing that as well. Other than that the hotel staff were very friendly, and the bed was AMAZING!! We ended up sleeping in on both occasions. The breakfast was delicious and there was a massive choice. And the location was pretty good, a wee bit out of town, but we hired bikes and could be at Leidesplein within 10 mins, and the tram from there was even quicker. So overall if you can handle the bathroom situation I would recommend this hotel. As we couldn't I won't be going back. For a tip for visiting Amsterdam, rent bikes, they were fantastic for getting us around all the sites and visit the Ij brewery, much better than the famous green one!

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet location, good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Marukita
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at Park Plaza Vondelpark. We love this hotel especially because of its location, it is a block away from the beautiful park in one of the classiest and prettiest neighborhoods in Amsterdam, in my opinion. The surroundings are very quiet, but you are still at a walking distance from all the attractions, museums, restaurants, bars and coffeeshops. The tram stop is just a block from the hotel. The hotel is modern and the rooms are quite comfortable and luminous. The bed is amazing and the pillows are very comfy as well. We were disappointed with the bathrooms (are almost incorporated in the bedroom, only separated by a glass wall): the shower didn't have a curtain so it got the whole bathroom wet and there wasn't a fan to take odour out so the whole bedroom would stink after using the WC. Also, the lighting was a bit poor, especially if you like reading a book at night. There were some minor maintenance issues as well, like water leakage from the window, ripped carpet, and clogged sink, but were fixed quickly. Breakfast is delicious and in winter they have a especial for 13 euros, which is very convenient since it has everything you need to keep you full for hours (eggs, croissants, salmon, bacon, cappuccino/hot chocolate, cereal, fruits, etc). There is no restaurant in the hotel to have dinner, the bar only serves tapas and they are very expensive, so just walk a couple of blocks and go to "Tapa Feliz" or "Serdegna" where they serve great food for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ctanski
Reviews.Content: We took the train in Amsterdam to the main station, then took a tram from the station, it stops directly infront of the hotel. Lobby is small, but there is free use of the computers. We got to our room, you get two small beds and a stand up shower very close to the beds. It was perfect for a sleep, clean, and in a good location, close to bus stop. Felt like a hostel instead of a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great price in a nice area!”
Reviews.Author: Rob C
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal 3 night for price of 2. The hotel is in a nice location out of the busy centre and close to the museum district. Easy reached by tram. The room had everything we needed and was clean. The staff helpful and always available.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, chic modernistic reception area . . . and more. . .”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvlr84
Reviews.Content: I really loved those fun chairs in the reception area. I was tempted to sleep in them, except the beds in my room were so comfortable. The rooms were a bit "cozy" but I was spending more time seeing the sights of the city, so it didn't really matter. I enjoyed a really nice glass of red wine at the bar, and loved the little plate of appetizers that came with it. In keeping with the artsy decor of the lobby, the hotel is only a 15 minute walk from the museum district, or you can take the number 2 tram, and continue all the way through the city center to the Central Station. We booked through Hotels.com, and unfortunately, they did not show the breakfast plan which was available by booking directly through the hotel. At first the price of the breakfast buffet seemed expensive, but if you drink 3 or 4 cups of coffee at breakfast like I do, and given the 3+ Euros per cup which most restaurants in Amsterdam charge (without refills), than it probably pays for itself. My only objection to this hotel was the so-called coffee maker which they advertise in the rooms. It turned out to be nothing more than a hot water heater with packets of instant coffee. Although the receptionist did make me a cup of espresso in the front desk espresso machine when I asked if it was ever used.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place, starting to show some wear and tear”
Reviews.Author: Sir_Top-Hat
Reviews.Content: This is one cool place! the hotel and rooms have an interesting modern character. As long as you like this, you will not be disappointed by the rooms. Good size, excellent amenities, including down comforters and pillows. Unfortunately the the property is starting to show signs of wear and tear. If you are not bothered by the slightly old looking carpets, or the occasional scratched surface, you cannot go wrong here. The location -in a beautiful residential neighborhood in the "old south" quarter- is perfect. Only 10 to 15 mins from all the attractions with the tram that goes by the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Amsterdam and Park Plaza”
Reviews.Author: JoJo199099
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed in park plaza with another couple over new years eve, we booked a package deal with Expedia. On arrival to the hotel we were all impressed, modern,clean reception area and a very helpful receptionist who printed off lists of things for us to do over new year and gave us info on the tubes. Our rooms were the same - both clean and had everything we needed for a 48hour trip - tea,coffee,info books on Amsterdam and a very clean bathroom - the glass door is not as bad as i expected as it was round the corner from the bed/desk area! The only annoying thing from a girls view was the lighting - not good for applying make up! oh and that it was a non smoking room - we weren't given an option when booking! On are last evening - after being extremely knackered we ate in the bar - this was great - very stylish and again the staff lovely. The menu was basic - burgers/chips etc but im sure when the main restaurant is open there is more choice! Amsterdam is a crazy city - it seemed even busier as it was new year - 24 hour fire works - some beautiful and some dangerous - bangers going off next to our feet down every street, as long as you kept an eye out it was ok - funny really ( if in england it would have been classed as a riot) police were cool about the situation. Personally we all loved our trip - being young enjoying the bars/coffee shops and shopping (although most shops closed new years day which was a shame as us 2 girls had decided that would be our main shopping day)! We walked alot to find our way around but when we did take the tram it was very easy 1,2 or 5 (not 125 that we first thought haha) took us back to the hotel and it was about 12 minutes. Any questions please ask, hotel,coffee shops,food, red-light district etc

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have stayed at in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: funnyboy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are regular visitors to Amsterdam and booked the hotel on a special offer site. Not knowing this part of the city and reading varying reviews we did not know what to expect. The hotel is located about 15mins fom the centre by tram number 2 that runs to Central station. The best thing to do if you are there for a few days and the weather is not too good is to get a daily or 2 day tram card which is good value and you dont have to worry about always having cash on hand as no journey is less than 2.60 euros no matter how short.yes the trams can get crowded but they are ferquent and as long as you are careful with your belongings, as in any other major city ,it is the ideal way to get about . We had an executive room with views of the park.The bed was huge and the walk in bathroom is in a glass cubicle so it is quite unique.Shower is good and there are bathrobes and slippers. In the room there is also a nespresso machine but I prefer a kettle.My only criticism is there is only 1 small mirror in the bathroom but i mentioned this at reception and hopefully this will be sorted in the future.Sometimes the housekeeping was a little strange and no tea and coffee was left and sometimes only 2 towels and 1 bathrobe but this was immediately sorted with a call to reception. The reception staff were lovely and friendly and offered advice when it was needed. Our deal included breakfast which was excellent and varied with quality ingredients and lovely bread and pastries as well as a hot section,fruit and yoghurt and even smoked salmon. The decor of the reception and bar is modern but comfortable and everywhere is spotlessly clean. I wouldnt recommend the hotel for dsiabled guests as there are 2 seperate buildings and a number of steps.There is no evening restaurant in the hotel but bar snacks are available and there are restaurants within a 5 min walk. I would recommend the hotel for a nice city break in a safe area with pleasant staff and nice bar and breakfast room.Any one that can find a better hotel for the price at this time of year would be lucky and hopefully the next time we visit the city we will be able to stay at the Park Plaza Vondelpark.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: alanandcaz
Reviews.Content: We were more than happy with this hotel, set away from the hussle and bustle of the centre, which is easily accessible using the nearby tram stop. The room smallish but perfectly adequate with a large bed and the infamous glass frosted bathroom doors. There is a fridge and a safe in the room as well as a coffee machine. The only critism I would say is that there is one mirror in the bathroom and the lighting is not so bright. Our room was located in one of the buildings next to main reception on the third floor, facing the road. A little noisy with the trams going past, however we did not feel this adversly affected our stay. The room was bright and airy. Vondelpark is lovely and well worth a walk around. I would imagine it is stunning in the spring/summer. All in all, ourselves and the other couple who travelled with us were more than happy with the accommodation and the staff who were friendly and approachable. We would definately prefer to come back but i would ask for a room facing away from the road next time. We also loved that being a little out of the way, on travelling towards the centre, we could hop on and off the tram visiting less busy entertainment areas than the main hub which we could well have missed had we opted for a central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Somu S
Reviews.Content: very bad place to stay small room and they charged me two time on my credit card for one night stay and refused to pay me back very bad hotel and service is awful i hope the hotel is shut down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BradAndLee
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam and the hotel made the trip perfect. Close to everything but in a quite area...plus ultra close to public transport, great international food, & good bars in area/hotel. The hotel was fun and funky...and a clear bathroom (shower to toilet...clear). I would stay in the same hotel again and will try to every time I am in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “In a nice area of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: 9gc
Reviews.Content: We spent sometime searching Trip Advisor for a suitable hotel for a 2 night stay in Amsterdam with our two friends who were joining us in The Netherlands. We have previously stayed in the NH Amsterdam City Centre Hotel but were put off by the inflatted price they were asking for, for this weekend (This particular weekend is the Amsterdam Dance Event which could be the cause for inflated prices around the city). We found the hotel to be resonable price so decided to go with this. The city and specifically Dam Square is within a 5 minute tram journey. There is a tram stop some 300 yeards down the road which is superb for getting around the city and to and from Central Station. Very quiet and nice area of Amsterdam, away from the hussle of the red light district and any bars. The hotel itself is modern, clean and perfect for a city break. The rooms though small, were all we really needed as a couple. For anyone with a wheelchair or pushchair it maybe a little swkward. One thing to note is the toilet/shower is actually in the room with a glass partition seperating a wet room off from the remainder of the bedroom. Our room has a flat screen Samsung TV with a selection of British, Dutch and German TV channels. There is a nice bar area downstairs which was ideal for a quick drink before heading out into the city. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a budget hotel away from the city centre but within a short tram journey. Staff we're all friendly and helpful, enjoyed our stay and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “not worth 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: xronis
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not a 4 stars hotel. They try hard with the design , to make it look hype and cool but the room we had was nothing but. Badly designed rooms and old carpet flooring. The staff was not helpful at all when we realized that they have charged us more than we agreed for our booking. The only positive about this hotel is the location , next to vondelpark. Apart form that you are better off to a 3 or even 2 star hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location Near Park”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Park Plaza (Museum Quarter) for 3 nights. After taking an overnight 11 hour flight from LA to Amsterdam, the hotel staff graciously accomodated us by allowing us to check in early. It is a 15 min tram ride from Central Station. Our room was in the second building (there are multiple buildings that make up the hotel) which required us to haul our bags down a long flight of stairs (this was a draw back - no elevator or ramp to get down to the lower level) to get to our building. Once there, the room was for the most part very good and we had a room with a king bed which was spacious. Our room had a nice size shower/toilet area but it wasn't in a separate room - it was a frosted glass walled off area - open at the top. For the most part this was fine with the exception of some lack of privacy when using that area. A real positive was how quiet the room was even with the windows open. It made for wonderful sleeping. The hotel had a nice bar area which was great for late afternoon/early evening drinks (good prices as well). The bar has a great patio area overlooking a quiet street. The hotel has wireless but the free version is pretty slow and requires logging on every time you shut your browser. This hotel is Vondelpark-adjacent which was a real plus for using the park (which was very nice). At the hotel we were able to rent bikes which allowed us to roam around not only the park (visitors need to experience "rush hour" on the park pathways) but the old city. The hotel was also within walking distance (15-20 min) from all the main museums but not as convienent for getting to the old city by foot (tram or bike is much quicker). The hotel neighborhood is a real plus. Lot's of local restaurants within a 10 minute walk which were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent penthouse - great breakfast - good value”
Reviews.Author: MardleyMassif
Reviews.Content: We raod tripped from Hertfordshire via Calais and Bruges into Amsterdam, arriving one Saturday evening with no reservations. There were no rooms in any inns in the town centre, so we drove randomly out of the city in the Vongels park direction. Fortuitously we stumpled upon this venue. Admittedly we got a good "last minute" deal Admittedly for the penthouse we paid less for the 4 of us than we would have done for the scummiest of hotels in the city centre. But on the basis above - I would struggle to find fault. I'll single out 5 things that were great: 1.tram stop maybe 50m up the road takes you right into the heart of Amsterdam (no.2?) 2.breakfast included and really very good 3.room facilities included great TV and excellent Nespresso coffee maker & unlimited pods 4.staff at reception and in the bar were faultless 5.very very friendly and very very comfortable Certain areas of the hotel and out buildings could do with a lick of paint or upgradeing but we were really really happy with our find.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: OrsiD
Reviews.Content: Located near to the city center, executive room was huge, with a king size bed. Wired internet connection is free and fast. Buffet breakfast has a wide variety of hot and cold choices. The reception staff was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: mofongo
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 3 nights for my adult daughter and myself. The choice was made based on the following criteria: we wanted free wifi, breakfast included, and a/c (well, you never know). From a previous visit to AMS, decades ago, I was mindful of all the lovely canalside hotels, but my concern over too many steep stairs steered us to the Vondelpark area. As others have noted, mixed reviews of this hotel leave one wondering what to expect. What we found was a lovely end room facing the main street--lots of light, comfy beds, amazing storage options [an entire wall of cupboards with shelving, hanging rods and safe], and the largest bathroom I have ever seen in a European hotel. The mini-fridge was another welcome surprise. I gather from reading other reviews that we were fortunate to have had such a pleasant room--some of the others sound deplorable. Staff were enthusiastic and welcoming. After calling reception to ask whether an iron was available, I was surprised by a knock on our door within 5 minutes: not housekeeping staff, but the actual reception agent herself, iron and board in hand. We appreciated the proximity to the tram stop (Emmastraat) and the village-like feel of the neighborhood. Being a few minutes' tram ride from the center was not a negative for us. Would have loved exploring the park, but a lot of rain and too little time made that impossible. A propos of the rain, sloshing around in it all day long made the hotel bar area with its gas fireplace a cozy retreat in the evening. We also enjoyed the hotel breakfast--quite extensive, in my opinion, and presented in a comfortable, colorful atmosphere. The setup made for good traffic flow around the various stations, a feature which we also found to be somewhat unique. I had one negative comment to make upon checking out, which concerned a spot of mildew in the corner where wall met tub. It got a little worse every day we were there, and was maybe size of a US quarter coin after 3 nights. The desk agent made note of the room number and indicated it would be addressed immediately. Even realizing we may have had one of the few large, bright rooms in the hotel, I would still recommend this property and will stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for seeing Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: HJCLondon
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend at the hotel. It is a great location because you are very close to everything - either by bicycle or short ride on the No.2 tram passing by outside - but not right in the middle of the bustle of the city, so it is a quiet and relaxed atmosphere. The no.2 tram takes you from Centraal Station to the hotel in about 20 minutes, so it couldn't be easier. The park is also lovely to visit and offers a green and pleasant route into town, with the Rijks and Van Gogh museums very close by. Our room was spacious and very comfortable and the staff could not have done more to make our stay a success with their warm, friendly and helpful attitudes. Definitely recommend it for an Amsterdam visit and will return.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not deserve 4 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Elmyra134
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 days for Park Plaza Vondelpark and explicitly wrote that we were newly wed, expecting a nice room. However, when we arrived to hotel, they showed us a room literally in the underground fromwhich windows you could see only neighbour walls. The bathrooms were in the room only separated by glass separators which were very inconvenient to use. Towels were very low quality and hanging in downside of lavatory. Our room was in fire door place which should be kept shut all times. Overall, no value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location- helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mr_and_Mrs_Calli
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be useful for the type of trip we were on as it was conveniently located in a pleasant part of the city, a short walk from Vondelpark and the Museumplein. It was in a pretty quiet location without being too far removed from the sights. If you don't want to walk far there is a convenient tram stop about 2 mins away. The staff were very helpful, but for the price, we felt the room was quite basic. The shower was in need of a little maintenance and the toilet was a bit wobbly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but really tiny room, and a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: data_wrangler_nyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend, and our room was clean and nice but barely bigger than the two beds. Once our bags and stuff were in it, there wasn't even space to walk around. I was also surprised by how far it was from the downtown areas -- it's right next to the Vondelpark (which also made for a nice bike ride home), and convenient to the Museumsplein where the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum are, and there is also a tram stop nearby, but there's no nightlife and very few restaurants near the hotel. Also, when you use the wireless, it's free for a connection that's bandwidth-limited and SUPER SLOW and you have to pay to get actual high-speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: ejennings11
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not a 4 star hotel. The carpet is badly stained. Room smells like mold is growing in carpet. Staff at front desk cold and somewhat rude. Water and soda $7.00. Complained about air conditioning every morning and never helped. The room is hot........if u open windows, street traffic keeps you up all night. I begged them to fix AC the last night......."I haven't slept in 4 nights, can you PLEASE fix AC?" No, never fixed. I payed over 225$ per night to be tortured. Wrote to 3 different Park Plaza sites and NO response. How kind?

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: MEROa
Reviews.Content: A bit too far from the center. But there's a tram line infront. Nice clean rooms. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and lovely room”
Reviews.Author: catrieney
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my partner for two nights. price - took me a while to find a good deal online but then i found this hotel. excellent hotel in an ideal location and the price was very reasonable compared to others! location - really nice and quiet area. tram stop about 2 minutes walk away. nearest one being Emmastraat. about 5 minutes ride to Leidsplein which is a really popular entertainment / shopping area. about 10-15minutes from main square. walked from main square to hotel once and this took maybe just over 30minutes. room - arrived at 1.30pm and our room was not ready yet. returned at 2.45 and the room was STILL not ready but the lady behind the desk was very nice and upgraded us straight away to one of the executive rooms! this was gorgeous and apart from the glass bathroom doors this room was perfect. even as a couple travelling together the glass bathroom doors were not ideal. we are very comfortable together but some things should definitely remain left to the imagination! apart from this the hotel was lovely and situation right next to the Vondelpark. would be perfect on a hot summers day!

Reviews.Title: “Good room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: typisttrisha
Reviews.Content: Room was in Building 2 (Room 16) great room, huge bed, very clean, glass bathroom as before but it was OK. Cleaned every day, fresh towels and refills for coffee machine. Breakfast was not so good, quality of hot food was not too good but plenty of rolls, cold meat, yoghurt, coffee. As before it is a bit out of the way for city centre but tram no. 2 stops just up the road and it goes right across the centre. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Mel32
Reviews.Content: It was ok, our twin room was a bit small for 2 friends sharing (even though they said we'd been upgraded) and the bathroom is behind a glass wall so not much privacy!! The location is a bit out of town for the the main attractions although it's a lovely neighbourhood with some cool places for Sunday brunch. Beware the checkout time, they manically called the room when we were only 5 minutes late!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel, not even close”
Reviews.Author: Helen1990
Reviews.Content: I don't understand how this hotel can be rated 4-star, not by any means in any part of the world! The location is not too bad, but not very close to any locations of interest (museums, resturants...). To get in to the hotel from the street adn to get to the room we stayed, we had to carried the luggages up and down the stairs before we can get to the elevator. The room is not well-lit and doesn't look very clean. There is no furniture in the room other than a tiny desk and a plastic chair. The bath room is just a small glass-walled shower next to the toilet with only a half wall between them. The tiny wash basin has to be located outside the "bathroom". The window curtains do not close completely so be prepared to wake up early in the morning. With wind and rain during the night, it is not possible to sleep at all because you can hear it all! If you want a bottle of water, the only place you can get is from the hotel bar, and it would cost you 6.50 Euros for the 500cc bottle! We finally decided to change to a different hotel after just one night's stay instead of the original plan for a week. When we checked out, the stern faced staff charged us 169 Euros instead of the 148 we were told while booking through a travel agent 4 months ago. OK, enough whining, but the bottom line is that this is THE most expensive hotel I ever stayed anywhere in the world for it's value.

Reviews.Title: “Flamboyant decor, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: AR_itani
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in July. When we first entered I was somewhat surprised with the flamboyant decor, pink chairs, orange carpets, hanging chairs from the roof etc... The decor was not my cup of tea to be honest but I lived! In terms of the rooms, we got an upgrade to the executive room in the new building. Room was very clean ( much cleaner than the stained orange weird carpet) the bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was good. A couple of concerns: we struggled to find a way to call room service (maybe we didn't try hard enough) internet connection needs restarting and logging in every single time weird y they didn't create a simpler way. In terms of the location even though a bit far from the attractions its located in a classy neighborhood and just take the tram on the nearests station (no 2) and will get u there in 10 -15 mins max. In summary will be my first choice hotel no but for the value versus other hotels we checked out it's very convenient and practical.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel--beware of open bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Babina
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two buildings-- an older one with normal bathrooms, and a newer one where the bathroom "door" is a glass wall that doesn't come up all the way to the ceiling-- ie, sharing the room with a friend can lead to some interesting experiences. Otherwise, quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyCanuckinottawa
Reviews.Content: In Amsterdam for a confence at the Rai. The hotel is about a half hour walk to the Rai or is in front of the tram line though it takes 3 trams to get to the Rai from here. It is close to the Museumplein and right by the Vondelpark. Its room are clean with a comfortable bed. The decor is a bit dated and over this is a 3+ hotel by North American standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Cricket2005
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 15 minutes outside the heart of downtown, but Amsterdam has an excellent tram system. We caught the tram about a block from the hotel each day with no problems. The hotel is nice. Our room was clean and well-maintained. Our mattresses were firm enough to suit us. We were able to get a good night's sleep because there is no noticeable street noise. We did not choose the breakfast option. Instead, we visited a local market for our breakfast items such as croissants and fruits. The Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum are very close by, maybe 6 or 7 tram stops. the central train station is about 15 minute ride.

Reviews.Title: “Finally turned out well”
Reviews.Author: randn94
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and were well used to staying in Park Plaza hotels. On arrival we smiled at the receptionist and said 'I hope you have a nice room for us' - we were assured that it was so but in reality the room allocated to us was tiny, with no room on one side to get out of the bed to get to the bathroom. I went and complained, as we had booked a superior double room. The manager was called for who then apologised explaining that we had been given a superior single in error (in reality there had been nothing superior about that room at all, even though it was a single one). The replacement room in the annexe was certainly more superior and was both peaceful, spacious and comfortable. However there were no real tea bags supplied with the kettle and we had to request further shower gel on the second day. Why wasnt this automatically replaced? The washbasin was situated in the bedroom itself and its surrounding wood was both warped and the veneer surface was missing in places. The attached toilet and shower room was not separate from the main bedroom and had to be got used to; it wasnt embarassing for us but might have been for other couples staying there. The shower unit was excellent. Breakfast in the attractive breakfast room was reasonably good and was included in our package. We would not have paid for it separately; Carlson hotels have a habit of charging outrageously for their breakfasts. There was nothing in the room giving information about room service etc. The hotel is some distance from the centre but easily reached by tram number 2. Essentially we enjoyed this stay but one never enjoys having to complain and had we stuck with the original room the holiday would have been greatly spoiled. Effectively we were suspicious about the original allocation being a mistake.

Reviews.Title: “nice quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: nalston1690
Reviews.Content: the time it took for the bus to get us from the station to hotel we thought we were miles from city centre, but a 7 minute tram ride has you in with the action,and it is nice to get some peace to sleep in this quiet hotel; modern ,efficient staff, comfy beds, good sized room, made for a pleasant stay,,not sure about glassed bathroom either!

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: luxe_travelLondon
Reviews.Content: what worked well: - location: although not directly in the city centre, it is situated in a quiet, leafy and pleasant suburb. You can either take the tram Nr 2 into town, or walk through the Vondelpark - cleanliness of the room was adequate - coffee machine in the room provided us with surprisingly good coffee. Although the sachets weren't refilled the next day. what didn't work well: - bathroom: although it looked fairly new and modern, I just cannot understand how anybody can think that a bathroom that does not give you any privacy whatsoever is a good idea! As others pointed out, you hear EVERYTHING through the glass partition - and see a great deal. And if that wasn't bad enough, there is NOWHERE to hang your clothes, or even your towels! Housekeeping just leave them on a little stool, but that;s obviously no good when they're wet. It's an astonishing design concept! Possibly the least functional I've ever encountered. - bedroom: looked tired. water stains on ceiling, dark stains on the orange (!) carpet - bar/ lobby service: although pricey, the service was poor, and they're not open throughout the day All in all, while it wasn't terrible, we won't be returning to the Park Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjmod
Reviews.Content: One word to some it up! WOW!! We had the Jacuzzi penthouse suite! AWESOME!! Great view, nice relaxed location, easy to travel to and from with public transport and super friendly staff! Love the breakfast room and bar area. Very modern design!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in lovely part of town, walk to the museum district”
Reviews.Author: goanna47
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great base to see the rest of Amsterdam. It is not particularly central but is in a lovely expensive-looking part of Amsterdam near the museum district (15 mins walk to Van Gogh) and the Vondelpark (almost next-door). A tram line runs directly outside the hotel with a stop just a minute's walk away; this will take you right into the centre of town and the central station in about 15 minutes. There are restaurants and bars in the surrounding streets but it's not a busy or particularly lively part of town (we really liked this), and is a very restful base. The rooms themselves were spacious, a bit shoddily finished (eg cracks where they didn't finish the surfacing on the side of the shower tiles) but overall quite stylish and comfortable. The bathroom was in-room with a frosted glass wall separating it visually, which meant it was small but serviceable. In-room tea and coffee was good; they didn't provide much though and didn't replace it often. When I checked the room as we left, under the bed I noticed some rubbish (a tissue, some packaging, not from us) which didn't impress me but the rest of the room was spotless - I assume this was very much a one-off and they'd simply forgotten to clean under the bed. Service was very good. Our wireless internet wouldn't work and several others seemed to have this problem too. We went to the front desk who "reset" something which didn't work; we went back and they gave us a voucher which worked fine. The double bed was two singles combined with shared bedding. We were on the first floor with a view of a nice garden, in the old building. It was very quiet. There were opening windows to the garden which were overlooked (but with good curtains). The cost was very reasonable. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to get away from the noise of central Amsterdam but be close enough to enjoy it very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Big_D74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very leafy and central location, close to museum square. The hotel is modernly decorated and has been further upgraded since we last stayed here three years ago. It now also has a nice bar with small outside seating area. We stayed in the old part of the hotel, where the rooms have also been refurbished. It suffers from the same styling as the new part: which means the bedroom and bathroom are only separated by a glass wall. This glass wall also does not run all the way up to the ceiling, meaning anything you do in the bathroom will be heard by however else is in the room. So only sleep here if you have no privacy issues with whoever you are staying with! Our room was absolutely TINY. Just a few feet bigger then the actual bed. Our friends stayed on the same floor a few doors down and their room was much bigger (for the same room rate) It is just luck of the draw which room you get. Though you can always complain of course! (something we did not bother with)

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking but pricey too”
Reviews.Author: veedubmelb
Reviews.Content: This is quite a nice hotel - the room is fairly big by European standards and seemed to have been fairly recently refurbished. It also had a balcony which was nice. The bathroom is a bit odd - it's actually a glassed in part of the room, rather than a separate room per se. Interesting concept, but it doesn't work: even when travelling with your partner, it just feels odd showering with only clear glass separating you from the main part of the room. There are also no towel rails or similar functional things - you have to hang your towels over the stool in the bathroom or the chairs out in the main room (or the shower screen, but that's no good if someone else is showering after you...). The front desk people were pleasant but the young guy didn't seem to have much of a clue about such things as how the public transport works (eg. he tried to tell us the 24 hour ticket gets you 24 hours of in vehicle travel, which doesn't make any sense at all). Overall - this place was okay, but a bit pricey and fails the 'little things' test that you expect when you're paying a bit more for a flashier hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Seperate Buildings?”
Reviews.Author: Tiggerwosere
Reviews.Content: Myself, daughter, sister and friend stayed here for a long weekend. My daughter often works in Amsterdam so used her points to purchase this break, only having to pay for one room. When we arrived she was told she had been given an update but we were put in two seperate buildings, which was strange to say the least. The hotle itself is in a leafy suberb near the park, which we took advantage of to have a picnic . Our rooms were average, but the "updated room " was smaller than the other one., it had a coffee maker but no kettle, and a wet room with glass wall ! We were given one teabag the first night, and none the next, had to ask for some. There wasnt a restuaurant for meals, just a breakfast room..The transport system in Amsterdam is really good, trams run very regular and are cheap, we also took advantage of the canal hop on hop off boat trips, a great way of seeing the city. At the end of our stay we were able to deposit our luggage in the sister hotel near the train station and continue site seeing until our evening flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but that's all that's going for it.”
Reviews.Author: Picky_but_reasonable
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment. While in a great neighborhood for walking and for taking the tram to the city center and museums, the hotel itself has severe issues. I was in an executive room -(should have been the best) and I went back to the desk to confirm it WAS an executive room. It was dirty - stains on the rugs, the sink is in a stand outside the bathroom and the table was covered in something that I had to scrub off, and if I spilled somthing like hand cream on the rug, it wasn't cleaned up the next day. The bed was extremely hard (and I like a hard bed). They claim to have room service, but it's acually the bar menu (which is limited to appetizers) and delivered by front desk people "when they have time." Breakfast was excellent - it was included in my roomrate, so I don't know the value - but it was the one thing I could count on at this hotel. Finally, the staff was some of the worst I've ever dealt with. There were two types behind the front desk - several lovely, soft spoken young women wo had apparently just started because every question required their going to the back room behind the desk, getting an answer, and coming back with it. Then there were the experienced people who were argumentative and snooty. The first night I was woken up by a man yelling and banging on doors in my hallway. I called the front desk and no one answered. He finally stopped, but I mentioned it the next day. The woman next to me had come down to ask about the same incident because the man apparently banged so hard on HER door that he got in. The clerk behind the desk said that it was impossible for him to get in without a key and that she must have given him a key. It was her first night there too, and it was clear that she wasn't giving keys to anyone - yet they blamed HER for the security issue. If, despite this, you WANT to stay here, I hope you sleep deeply, because any door that is opened and shut on your hallway causes your walls to shake and the loud bang woke me from sleep regularly. I will NOT go back, despite frequest trips to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: jfhvt
Reviews.Content: My son, his girlfriend and another friend all stayed at Vondelpark Amsterdam. Unfortunately they were delayed in the US by an unexpected snow storm. They were sceduled to leave on Sunday but were unable to get out until Tuesday. They advised the hotel of their situation so I am sure thast the hotel rentede their 2 rooms for the 2 nights that they weren't there. After calling Expedia repeatedly I was finally told today that the hotel has a" no refund" whatsoever policy. Regardless of your situation! I feel like if they want our business that they could try to help out some students who were stranded by bad weather conditions. Come on...should have thrown them a bone!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: johndornoch
Reviews.Content: First class 4 star hotel in quiet part of the city only 10 minutes from centre by 2.50 euro tram ride. Walking distance to the Rijsmusem and Van Gogh Museum. Hotel very comfortable and welcoming. Breakfast adequate but not exceptional. Nice bar and balcony, all close to Very pleasant Vondel Park. WiFi available.

Reviews.Title: “nice but only just”
Reviews.Author: cavus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good but not that good for the money, a long tram ride to the main centre, or a very good walk, if you look around you can find cheaper in the centre, did not eat Â£14 for breakfast, rooms good but the bathroom as part of your bedroom did make for a laugh, do not share with a person you dont know well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a cozy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarvinSoul2010
Reviews.Content: I just got back from spending 7 nights at this hotel. We had a standard type room which was on the small side but fairly comparable to other European hotels. After checking in, we were welcomed with a tray of fruit, a bottle of water and a letter from the hotel manager. The bathroom was as described by other reviewers but not as bad as I was expecting. The room was clean and well stocked with everything we needed. The hotel itself is in a great location if you want to be just outside of all the action. We felt safe exploring the neighbourhood at any time of the day. Vondelpark is a block away and is great for a walk. The tram is very accessible from the hotel which connects you to all the big attractions. I suggest buying a ticket valid for 1, 2 or 3 days which is a much better value than buying the 1 hour ticket from the driver. The tram stops running after midnight, but the hotel is only a 10-15 minute walk from the entertainment areas.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola1303
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying 2 nights in a Superior Room in this hotel. I wanted somewhere in a quiet location, about 20mins walk from the centre of town and reasonably priced - that's exactly what I got. I went with my partner and we're both keen walkers so it was good for us. The hotel is situated right next to the lovely Vondelpark which is nice and peaceful to walk through before reaching the busier streets. If you don't fancy the walk a tram leaves from right outside the hotel every 5-10 minutes and only takes about 5 minutes to reach the centre (cost around â‚¬3). We both loved our room. It was very clean and the bed was so comfortable. We did ask for a double room but it was two singles pushed together which wasn't too much of a problem. We thought the bathroom was a great novelty - only separated from the room by a partially frosted glass panel. This may put some people off but for 2 nights it was a bit of fun and you do still retain an amount of modesty! Great shower too. Overall the staff were friendly and helpful and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “its clean but really small, washing table is in the room”
Reviews.Author: myysmulders
Reviews.Content: the location is rather good, very convenient to go to Dam square, central station, but the room size is really small, it doesnt have even decent bath room, but cleaness is good, breakfast is rather simple. overall not so bad.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: travelright99
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very average and certainly not any better than a basic travelodge - we got the impression there were possibly much nicer rooms but ours was on the first floor of the adjoining building (rooms starting 150 (you are offered a gold card on arrival which amongst other things allows an upgrade to your room for about Â£20/night but on principle we felt you shouldn't have to ask to be upgraded all rooms should be as they are described). The stairway down to the rooms had a slightly damp smell and the main foyer did have as others have mentioned a slight drainage smell at times. However, this is a lovely part of town and there are some nice restaurants not far away if you are prepared to look for them. Tram 2 was easy to find and was a great way to get into the main town. The park was also nice to walk around. The neighbourhood felt very safe and nice to wander around. Hairdryer was cracked and the filter was filthy but the room was cleaned each day and the bed was extremely comfortable even if the duvet didn't seem very thick. Would recommend but suggest one of the better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel out of the main bustle”
Reviews.Author: Emmastraat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The room was clean and serviced daily. Slightly old decor but plain and fine. The double bed was two singles pushed together and two single duvets, but still comfortable. Although the weather was very cold, the room was always lovely and warm. I was a bit worried after reading (after booking) reviews of the dubious bathrooms. Thankfully our room was in the main building so we had a full frosted glass wall/door to it, rather than the creative excuse for one that other reviewers have described. Still not the best for privacy, but could be worse! The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We used the advertised free wi-fi in the bar and were shown to where we could use a printer (next to the front desk). We didn't eat at the hotel as it's so easy to travel elsewhere for cafes, etc. There are plenty of bakeries and delis nearby. The no.2 tram to the town centre is 1 minute along the road and very regular.

Reviews.Title: “Little Piece of Luxury - but comes at a cost”
Reviews.Author: supaberri
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location beside the Museum Platz. Amsterdam is a very easy city to navigate with fab public transport links so never worry too much about this. The rooms are lovely and is a little piece of luxury - however we got a cheap rate online room only. Breakfast is a whopping 25 euro per person extra. We ate in local cafes instead however they were tricky enoug to find, especially if you are looking for an early morning start. I have seen this hotel advertised at much higher rates so shop around and budget for your brekkie accordingly! On the big plus the hotel is clean and staff friendly. The only other thing I would highlight is the slightly open-plan nature of the bathroom to bedroom - my personal tip is turn the TV on if you want some privacy!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, away from Amsterdam main hustle & bustle”
Reviews.Author: GaryCI
Reviews.Content: Hotel, although located in a very nice area of usally bustling Amsterdam is a little far out of town. Car is not recommended and the Tram 2 stops more or less outside, however 20 minute walk to Leidesplein and another 20 minutes to Centraal Station

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced, tired and in need of redesign and thorough cleaning.”
Reviews.Author: muddysox Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it is supposed to be near the Museums Quarter. But there is still a good walk there (not next door by a long shot) and, Amsterdam being what it is, it makes a lot of sense to try and stay downtown if possible. The Rijksmuseum has a massive queue to get in, so it is necessary to get there either super-early or very late, so if you are going for a late entry, the location near(ish) the museums becomes irrelevant. The bathroom floor becomes very cold and you have to walk around it barefoot (this seems to be a Dutch speciality) unless you use of of the towels as a mat, which of course is stupid to say the least. The bed was way too big, a size suitable for three people sleeping together. Internet is payable separately (as if they were not charging enough yet!). Room service is available but slow and the menu is very limited and the food not particularly good. The temperature never became really warm in January; an electric heater was available but we neglected to plug it in, which was definitely necessary. I deeply regretted staying in this hotel specially at the price we paid. I would return to Amsterdam but stay at the Ibis which is next door to Centraal Station and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not Four Star”
Reviews.Author: dcalexander1
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel is decieving. The staff was very friendly and kind. But the hotel reminded me of a glorified dormitory-like it could have been a hostel in its life. Cleanliness definitely could use some improvements. A towel in our room was dirty/very stained. The only attractions within walking distance were art museums. The trams stop running at 12:15. It costs us 20 euro for a cabe ride from Leidsplein to the hotel. I wouldn't stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: kyslota
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our trip to Amsterdam. I booked it largely due to the price, location, and reviews I'd read on TA. The hotel was not difficult to find since we had a map printed from Google Maps, but we had a bit of confusion with which bus to take. Tram #2 goes directly down Koninginneweg, the stop for Emmastraat / Koningslaan is closest to the hotel, I believe. Our room was not in the main building, but in the building next door. Large room with comfortable king bed, view of the street, a "trendy" bathroom, large TV, wardrobe, etc. The bathroom was interesting, not very good for privacy. Wireless internet is not free in the rooms, but you can get vouchers for free use in the lobby in the main building. Since we had prepaid for the room, check-in was easy. The hotel is maybe a ten to fifteen minute walk to the Van Gogh Museum, and a little bit longer to Leidesplein where all the restaurants are. We walked everywhere, even to the Anne Frank House, but we did take the tram when returning to the hotel (lots of rain!). The trams are pretty easy to figure out, but don't forget to check in/out with the chip card, we kept forgetting to do that at first because no one told us! There is a nice bakery down the street where we bought sandwiches and muffins for breakfast. The staff at the front desk wouldn't help us by calling the Tickets & Tours office to book a tour for us, they said that we should do it from the room. Don't bother using the phone, but walk down to the nearest Tickets & Tours kiosk and book there. All in all, we had a good stay and even though both of us were sick with a cold, we enjoyed our time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: MB123England
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Plaza for 3 nights earlier this month. Hotel is of a good standard. Very modern with only a small amount of fraying around the edges. Staff were very helpful. Hotel was clean and tidy. The superior room we had was of an excellent standard with a very comfy bed. We slept very well. The bathroom took a little getting used to but didnt really bother me and my wife that much. Was strange having the sink in the bedroom tho! We didnt have breakfast here as we thought it a little expensive so we went to a cafe round the corner. Hotel was a 20 min walk into the centre of Amsterdam and is situated in an upmarket area of the city. The tram was also right outside which was useful. When we are next in Amsterdam more than likely we will stay here. Good value hotel thats part of the Radisson group. Taxi fair from Schipol to Park Plaza should not be more than 38 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Good Locatio”
Reviews.Author: DoronBr
Reviews.Content: Personally I am a fan of Amsterdam and I got to stay in this hotel twice, once for business and the other time for pleasure and in both cases I enjoyed the stay very much. As for the business travel I found the location close to the clients offices and during the evening it was a walking distance or a short tram ride to leidsaplain which is a good area to spend your evenings. The breakfast buffet isn't the cheapest but you get a good value for it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, kind & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: meldabs30
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not fancy, but is was comfortable and clean. It was on a quiet street, but an easy 2 minute tram ride to the museumplein area. The staff were very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, limited service”
Reviews.Author: Bagehot99
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one week as part of a business trip to Amsterdam. Hotel is very well located, close to Vondelpark and nice restaurants. I was upgraded to an Executive room so I can't talk of the normal rooms but mine was good, with design furniture and confortable bed. However limited service, with no real room service (stops at 10pm) and no fitness center. Great for a short stay, less for a long business stay.

Reviews.Title: “almost excellent”
Reviews.Author: Attila23
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel in a posh area, 150m from the vondel park, 3 tram stops from the museums. great value hotel but bring your earplugs if you sleep light because the rooms have a very noisy locking system, making the return of your fellow guests as noisy as possible. The rest is agreeable: wide rooms, tv & music, open shower (toilets also, alas) and confy beds. handy but tasteless buffet breakfast, still, good value. Service is extremely proffessional and warmly welcoming, really appreciated! Will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - lacking in any sort of luxury”
Reviews.Author: jenny12368
Reviews.Content: Was a little apprehensive about this hotel having read a few less than good reviews on this site (sadly only AFTER booking it!). My concern was justified when we checked in and were shown to our room. The carpet had disgusting big stains all over which was not acceptable. We asked to be moved, and were given another room, again with stains but smaller ones this time. We were in a triple room and the staff said there are not many of these at the hotel, so we accepted the room as the best available. The rooms are generally a bit scruffy and in need of TLC. Only a single rather lumpy pillow is provided and the duvets were similarly very lumpy and uneven. The brochure we had booked through rated this hotel as 4 star which one would hope would feel at least a little bit luxurious, but sadly no. I got the impression from reading on this site that the new block is perhaps better - we were in the old block. All the carpets in the corridors are also stained really badly and I did not feel the general standard of cleanliness throughout was that good. There seemed to be no attention to detail at all. All seemed a bit soul-less and unloved. You just sort of got the impression no-one really cared about the place or the standards. The bar and breakfast room are very trendy (my kids loved them) but it is very superficial and certainly the rooms we were in were not modern or trendy. We were also woken at 4.30 a.m. by the TV switching on automatically and were surprised to find at breakfast that the TV in my parents' room down the corridor (we were having a 3-generation trip!) had also switched on at the same time. When we enquired at the desk we were told it must have been an incorrectly programmed wake-up call. They were not at all apologetic though. In the main the staff were helpful but you did feel they perhaps were good at dealing with complaints because they got a lot of them. Very noisy at night - the doors bang so if anyone was checking out early then it woke me up. Disturbed more than once each night. On the plus side - nice breakfast with lots of choice. Overall - if it had been cheaper or rated lower, would probably have thought it not so bad - but having booked it as supposedly very modern, 4 star then could not fail to be disappointed. Although to be honest, regardless of star rating I don't think massive stains on the carpets are ever acceptable. I would look elsewhere if I were you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern rooms in a quiet location...”
Reviews.Author: RufusBambufus
Reviews.Content: If you like modern and trendy, this hotel fits the bill. Situated in a quiet residential neighbourhood but still only about a 20 minute walk from Leidesplein, most of which is a very nice stroll either in Vondel Park or along lovely Amderstam streets. Or take a 5-minute tram ride -- very easy. Several restaurants and cafes nearby but if you are looking for more variety, head to Leidesplein. The rooms were great -- clean and comfortable and the staff were great. The buffet breakfast (an extra $13 euros each) was perfectly adequate but not outstanding. Highly recommended if you don't mind being a little ways (and I mean just a little) out from the main center.

Reviews.Title: “very poor service - this is not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: omer2710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in the end of September for 5 nights. The hotel is very clean and modernly designed, and located in a nice and quite neighborhood near the park and not far from the city center. However, as for the service - this is not a 4-star hotel at all. To begin with, we had to take our luggage ourselves to the room - to get there we had to pass through a steep staircase until the elevator. The room itself was extremely uncomfortable. The bathroom and bedroom were in fact a one space - highly inconvenient for a couple. Furthermore, there was no mirrors in the room (other then one tiny mirror inside the closet), and the sink was situated outside the so called bathroom. when we got to Amsterdam it was already cold at night, however the central heat system was still set to summer mode, meaning that it was quite cold in the room. On top of that, we were equipped with two single and relatively thin quilts, although the room was ordered for a couple. It took us 3 days before we got a descent quilt, and the heat system was not set to heat the room throughout our stay, even though we asked for it repeatedly. And to top that, the hotel staff lost one of my girlfriend's shoes!! When we approached the hotel staff with that issue, nobody believed us. It got to the point where the hotel manager itself accused us of having an unusually untidy room, and that the shoe must be inside the room. When we checked out we insisted to be compensated in some manner, and about an hour after we left I received a phone call from the manager that the shoe has been found. The manager promised to send the shoe to our next destination via express mail, however, the shoe had reached that destination only 8 days after we left Amsterdam - we were already back home by then, causing us further inconvenience in our attempts to get the shoe back. In short - keep out of this hotel. This is by no means a 4-star facility, and the service was disrespectful to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended if you want to be far away from the main centre and in the quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Lilly79667
Reviews.Content: Quite hard to find at first, when advised the tram driver we need to get off by vondelpark, assuming the hotel would be nearby we were very wrong! The staff were very very helpful and friendly upon checkin and throughout the stay. Our room was quite average and small, and nothing like the pictures shown on here. The bathroom was small and like previous people have said about the frosted glass. Also there's a mirror right outside the door so for me staying with a friend not a partner, the thought that I was able to be seen through the glass door and then bouncing onto the mirror was not ideal! Tv was great, lots of choices and the ability to use it as a computer screen. Really recommend the iPod facility they have "music on demand" as there are a range of albums that fit everyones taste to play. As a typical Brit though, had to ask for proper tea bags as the ones given were lemon tea or earl grey. The staff were more than happy to give us more. I would recommend it but make sure you ask for a suite or deluxe exec room if you want anything that looks like the pictures on this site!!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: robmarrick
Reviews.Content: Booked and paid for 2 nights but only stayed 1, as service poor, staff rude and unhelpful. The room was also freeezing which actually matched the staff attitude! Looks good from the outside but don't expect a warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for leisure, not suitable for business”
Reviews.Author: polar_b
Reviews.Content: ROOMS My room was fairly small. All the rooms seem to have a smallish bathroom with a shower and a toilet. Note, the sink is on the OUTSIDE of the bathroom. This leaves no privacy for doing your personal hygiene stuff, you are inside the hotel room itself and it would feel awkward for me if sharing the room with another person. The products supplied are not many - a bar of soap, body lotion, shampoo and body wash, all of average quality. The aircon worked well, but was of the kind which never shut off and was constantly on. The thermostat was not correct, when set to 25C it was about 20C but you can work your way around that by just setting a higher temperature than you require. If opening the window please be aware that there can be some noise from the goings-on outside, there are some restaurants and bars in the area and sometimes some noise from people leaving these, you may also find that the tram trundling past creates noise which may prevent you from sleeping. However, when closing the window I heard no sounds from outside. No minibar, but they do supply a small fridge. Safe. Internet access in-room expensive, but free in the lobby. No ironing boards/iron, but you can request these from housekeeping. BREAKFAST is of average quality, but the standard varies. Sometimes the croissants were burnt, and sometimes there was no fresh bread. Some items were not available on some dais, so it's clear the selection of items varies. The scrambled eggs were obviously steamed and tasted a bit odd, but the bacon and sausages were fine. Otherwise, there are standard breakfast items like (mature) cheese, a few different types of ham, chorizo, and salami. Few items suitable for vegetarians. There is also youghurt, fruit salad, cerals, and of course hot and cold drinks. A nice touch was that they provided fresh mint leaves for making tea. LOCATION This hotel is not centrally located. However, it's right next to a big park, which is great for a stroll or a jog in the morning. It is also very near the Emmastraat tram stop. However it's a good 15-20 minutes on the tram going into town. Taxis rarely pass by outside so you can't just step outside and grab a taxi, but they can call one for you and they are usually very quick to arrive. SERVICE This is the only hotel I have ever stayed at which seem to have what amounts to a Service Level Agreement. Maybe it's not that formal, but when requesting something they will tell you that it will be available "within X minutes". They stand by their word, if you request an ironing board and they say it will be within 10 minutes or less, that is what will happen. The staff is obviously dedicated and very accommodating if you need something. In fact, when there were no taxis available the staff took two of my colleagues in a private car and drove them to their destination - saving my colleagues a very long wait for a taxi. That shows dedication. Note, there is NO room service at this hotel. Also there is NO laundry service on a Saturday - even though the piece of paper you fill in for your laundry indicates this is available, for a 50% surcharge. Laundry needs to be handed in by 08:30 and will not be retgurned untila abou 20:00 the same day. OVERALL I would not recommend this hotel to business travellers. For leisure travellers it's fine, just keep in mind you are a mile or so away from any "action".

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jagatinho
Reviews.Content: On the day of our departure we were leaving early (6:45), but the hotel didn't want to prepare breakfast for us although we've payed for it. They said breakfast is at 7h. Otherwise the hotel was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, modern rooms, good location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: music1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay. Our room was in the new building and was very modern and spacious with a modern bathroom partitioned with a glass wall! Very cool and stylish. The room had air con which was great as it is very hot in Amsterdam at the moment! The location of the hotel was good too. It is just behind the Vondelpark, which is a 15 minute walk to the leidseplein (a buzzing part of Amsterdam with loads of eating/drinking places). Alternatively you can take tram 2 into the town centre/central station. The Vondelpark was always buzzing, even at 12-1 am, when walking back to the hotel, which was good to still feel safe even at that time of night. If you like live music, there are several jazz clubs in the city centre which are really good. When paying the bill in the hotel we had to pay tourist tax which was 10euros. The Wifi is very expensive in the hotel and there's no free points in the hotel. However if you go to Hardrock cafe (in leidseplein) there is free wifi there! Overall a great hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comfort in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tinkubell
Reviews.Content: The last time I visited Amsterdam I stayed in one of those typical teeny-tiny hotel rooms at the top of four flights of very steep stairs. This seems to be common in Amsterdam and many hotels are set up like this. The Park Plaza Vondelpark was nothing like this. It was very modern-looking and the room we stayed in featured air-conditioning, a flat screen, and a huge bathroom. We squeezed three people into the room and had space for all of our luggage. The only weird thing was the bathroom door/wall was frosted glass and semi-transparent, and there was not enough room to fully open the bathroom door without hitting the desk chair. This was minor for me, but I guess it could bother some people. The front desk staff were really helpful and the lobby area is really cool-looking. It reminded me of the Standard Hotel in Hollywood but was actually a much better experience overall. I would definitely stay here again if I'm in Amsterdam -- it was very easy to catch the #2 tram from Centraal Station and reach the hotel within 15 minutes. Great location and very comfortable overall stay, especially for the price in the peak of summer (I got it on priceline.com for around $140 a night).

Reviews.Title: “good value for money but rooms need renouvation”
Reviews.Author: paccacuregge
Reviews.Content: we got a good special rate 128 euro for a triple room including bkf and for this price is ok but the room and especially the furnitures and bathroom need renouvation and never i will pay for full rate 190-200 euro because in this case you can find a better hotel,location is nice near vondelpark but it was difficult to find the hotel when we arrived the first day

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: chanthird
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Plaza Vondelpark in June 2010. When I arrived at the hotel, they told me the room I booked was not available and they would have to give me an upgraded room free of charge. OK! The hotel was very clean and my room was nice. The hotel is located on a quite street away from the hustle and bustle of city. The tram stop is 1 block from the hotel and you can be in the Leidseplein area in minutes. Around the hotel are some shops and cafes with outdoor seating, and a really nice area to walk around in. I was truly pleased with this hotel and its location. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sup3rgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent in every way: in a quiet area (near the museums' district) but in a walking distance from Leidesplein. Also tram number 2 took you from the corner right to Centraal Station in max 15 minutes. We had a non-smoking room which was great, very modern, clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful, but we actually didn't interact that much because there was not really much more we could ask for. We didn't have the breakfast included, but this was not a problem since in Amsterdam food is great and not more expensive than the breakfast at the hotel. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jillbeenz
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at this hotel. First impression was poor, we arrived late and were given a tiny room, with sloping ceiling and no view. I had booked a superior room with city view! However the next day we were given a different room which was absolutely fantastic in every way possible :) The location was wonderful, right next to a wonderful park, with easy stroll through to the busy city area. So best of both worlds. The hotel is very clean and well appointed. The staff were very approachable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I would go again, but...”
Reviews.Author: Pero25
Reviews.Content: I spent in Park Plaza 7 nights, so I think I can comment all things. Hotel is nice and modern, especially the V bar. Rooms are comfortable. Modern design is manifested mostly in bathroom. Here is my first remark; we really needed a mirror above the sink. I saw a lot of coments about smell and noise; but we did not have that kind of problems. The neighborhood is really peacefull. And for me position of hotel is perfect; near the park, with tram station in 100 m from hotel witch drives you to the downtown in 10 minutes. It is also good for going out of the city with a car. Here is my second remark; the parking around hotel is 4 Eur/h and the staff (the tall lady) did not want to help to find me more affordable solution. She didn't care. The next day I ask her to change me a bigger bill into a smaller, and she sad that for security reasons she can't do that. A??? So the staff didn't thrilled me, but because of all other reasons and the good price I would probably book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Sort out the drains”
Reviews.Author: BlueCambridge
Reviews.Content: The staff were without exception polite, cheerful and helpful, but they must be tired of receiving complaints about the smells. Comments have been posted for at least 8 months but the hotel hasn't sorted the problem. On my arrival the room had a stagnant water smell, but in the morning I woke to a disgusting smell of drains and had to hide under the duvet to escape it. Staff cheerfully moved me to a lovely room in building 3 which really was a 'superior' room, unlike the original which is described as superior but is rather ordinary, with the bathroom mentioned by other reviewers - there was hardly space to get off the loo, and I'm not by any means fat! The hotel itself is convenient and the breakfast is excellent but if you do book make sure you aren't allocated a room in the building at the back of the main hotel because that's where the problem is.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: jc435
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and thought it was excellent. The room was unique in the style and furnishings - very "european" and modern. The location was excellent as it was a 3 minute walk to the tram station and then 15 minutes or so to downtown Amsterdam. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The bar was nicely decorated and intimate. Overall, we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, but nice”
Reviews.Author: Banzai63
