Reviews.Content: This is a concrete structure, therefore any hallway noise ( and all of the doors slam shut due to the automatic closers), and every slamming door, or loud voice, (and there were several obnoxious Japanese staying here, who knocked on their traveling companions doors, and spoke loudly through the door), seemed like it was at our door. That being said, the staff was great, the location excellent, although the breakfast was waaay overvalued at 14.50 euros, no other meals available. The quaint picture on the web does not match the actual hotel. The web pic is quaint, the hotel modern and concrete. Other than the reverberation from the concrete building, and the obnoxious Japanese, it was OK. However, as those two items are beyond our control, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and nice location!”
Reviews.Author: Kad7374
Reviews.Content: Good price and nice hotel and the room was a good size. A little bit different from your regular hotel rooms as the bathroom is a partial frosted glass partition within the room! A little bit odd and not that great of an idea, as if your partner is showering the steam and noise affects the rooms! Other than that the rooms are nice and the beds very comfortable. The hotel is located on the boundary of Vondelpark in a quiet location really nice for a walk through, which takes you to the main entrance near to the museums about 10min walk, 15min to Leidse-Plein. Itâ€™s easy getting from the airport - train straight to Central Station, the trams are directly outside and you can purchase a chip and pin card (10 euroâ€™s with 5 euroâ€™s credit) it costs about 1.5 euroâ€™s to the hotel, but you can only top up with cash at the train station (ticket office) but it costs 50 cents for each transaction. I would recommend getting 5 - 10 euroâ€™s put on for travelling around Amsterdam. The No.2 tram stops near to the hotel - just get off at Emmerstratt and following the tram track and the hotel is approx 200m on the RHS. Trams run regularly until about 1am. You can also hire bikes from the hotel, which we didnâ€™t realise until our last day

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lamava
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Park Plaza Vondelpark were terrific. Running a bit ragged, my sister and I arrived at about noon on the day we were due to check in. We had planned on asking to stow luggage for the day, but they were able to check us in on the spot! The gentleman at the front desk also confirmed we were armed with tram and tourist maps and highlighted certain attractions around the city. Very kind. There is a computer in the lobby for use in printing (such as boarding passes or tickets to the Anne Frank Huis) and surfing the internet. Very handy indeed. The bar hosts a decent-priced menu and free wi-fi. We didn't wander out into the garden terrace as the weather was not really cooperating. The lifts are slow so we often opted for the stairs. Our room was on the 4th floor and spacious. The bathrooms were clean as well and the housekeeping staff were very friendly and efficient. The beds are fairly comfortable (the same can't really be said for the pillows) and we appreciated plopping down in front of the flat screen TV after a full day of walking around the city. I would certainly stay here again next time I am in Amsterdam. Transportation: Take Tram 2 from Centraal Station to get here. There are two stops very close to the hotel. (We used Willemsparkweg stop.) If you are in the city center, take Tram 2 headed to Nieuw Sloten. To Schiphol: The Park Plaza Vondelpark offers a shuttle to the airport. It is 14 euros per person. A taxi to Schiphol costs 33 euros so depending on your group size, a taxi may be more cost effective. (We opted for Tram 2 and then the train from Centraal which took about an hour.)

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed the stay!”
Reviews.Author: bigblonde72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. The location is lovely and Vondelpark is literally a few minutes walk away. We spent 2 mornings just wondering around in there and found a nice place to have breakfast! The tram line that runs through the are is the 2 and its a few stops in to town. We paid 19 euros at the airport for 4 days unlimited travel which is great value. The service was great and whilst the bar prices seemed a bit steep at first they compared with the rest of Amsterdam (approx 6 euros for half litre of lager) which can be pricey. We didn't do breakfast here because it seemed expensive, I think you're better off venturing out and finding something else...the aforementioned place in the park for one (10ish euros for 2 toasties and 2 coffees). The room was clean although I agree with a previous reviewer that the carpets need cleaning. It was big enough and whilst the glass bathroom is strange at first you get used it it v quickly! Free wifi is available in reception and the signal was still accessible in our room - just need the code which you get from reception. Oh and another thing I didnt realise is that there is a city tax which you pay on departure so be aware of this - 3.25 euros a day If you want to experience Amsterdam but dont want to be right in the middle of it all the time then you cant go wrong with staying a bit out of town and I would really recommend the vondelpark park plaza. Oh handy hint - there is a restaurant/cafe opposite the tram stop, highly recommend it. Fairly reasonable and the Dutch steak was AMAZING (16.5 euros so about Â£14-Â£15 so comparable to home) and seriously was the best steak I have EVER had! Sandwiches were lovely too lol

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Durrance_Bagale
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from 3 nights in Amsterdam, staying at this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful (well, they were Dutch, what else would you expect?!?!), the room was a decent size, the bed was comfortable and the huge wet room impressive. We only had breakfast on the last day. It was good, if expensive (37 euros for two people is really too much I think). The carpet could have done with a clean and also had obviously been fitted badly around the wet room, as it was frayed and a strip of floor was visible between the carpet and the wall of the wet room. I don't think the distance from the centre was a problem at all. It took us about 10 minutes to walk in and we only used the tram once, on the way from the station. The location next to the vondelpark was great. Overall I would happily recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but quite far from town centre”
Reviews.Author: Elaine1980
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money right on the edge of the beautiful Vondel Park with its lakes and pretty grounds. Late bar and friendly staff. Only downside for us was the distance to Dam square and the middle of the town but overall more than pleased since its right next to a tram stop to get to the further out places we visited during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: worknleisure
Reviews.Content: very accessible, situated in a quiet place near the famous Vondelpark. the hotel/room is clean, its modern. beds are nice and the bathroom as well. One thing i really like in this hotel is the breakfast, they served Dutch breakfast. best value for money :-)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience, basic room amenities”
Reviews.Author: Hedgefundmanager
Reviews.Content: If you visit Amsterdam again, AVOID coming during "Intertraffic" week. They just put up the room rates to sky high, and with little availability, you get a very basic room (which they call Superior) for EUR139 + breakfast extra, in what is just a 3 star hotel. My double room had a stale smell to it on entering, had no bath but just a walk in shower, a tiny glass topped desk, and cubby hole where the tea making machine was kept, thin white towels and a small wardrobe. As it was Intertraffic week, the in-room wifi connection for 24 hours was reduced to EUR9.50, but the connection was soooo slow it drove me mad! So it was ok but just not what I have experienced here in the past. At least the bed was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Blueronnie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in an upmarket residential area about ten minutes walk from Museumplein. The communication links with the airport and the centre of Amsterdam are excellent and you would be well advised to use bus or tram to get into the centre of town. Our first contact at Park Plaza was with the efficent and helpful reception; they were happy to help with directions, local restaurants and information about public transport. The day before we left we were also able to print out our boarding passes using the free internet service. Our room was a good size although the glass wall between the room and the bathroom was a little disconcerting at first - but it does allow more natural light into the room. We had a decent TV with BBC1 and sometimes BBC2 so Match of the Day was a possibility although on the downside the omnibus of Eastenders was also available. There were tea making facilities too and a couple of chairs to make the room a little more comfortable. Our only problem at the start was the heating which seemed to be set at a very high level - by the middle of the first night however we had managed to get it down to a reasonable temperature. We did think the carpet could have done with a bit of a clean too. The breakfast buffet was excellent and as breakfast was served until10am weekdays and 11am at weekends there was no queuing. Again the staff there were very friendly and helpful. There is also a small but very pleasant bar area - sadly the prices are expensive even for Amsterdam. In the locality there are many restaurants; we ate at a French style place, a tapas bar and a Sardinian restaurant all within walking distance. With the demise of the Â£ eating out is not cheap so be prepared. There is a great minimart nearby for botled water, snacks etc at very reasonable prices. There is also an entrance to Vondelpark just round the corner great place for a walk and to spot parrakeets, heron and stork; just be careful about the cycle traffic though. At about Â£80 per room per night Park Plaza is good value in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: chicken_features
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, paid about Â£80 a night for a standard room. Very happy, rooms are clean with a big TV, new bathrooms and nice bed. As with other reviews, yes the bathrooms don't have much privacy (glass) but it's not really an issue. The staff are very friendly and happy to help with any requests. We flew with BMI for Â£80 return, so overall a pretty cheap holiday. The location is good, it's not in the middle of the city but not too far out. From the airport you get the train to Central Station (15 minutes - 3.60 Euro) then take Tram 2 (15 minutes - 2.60 Euro) to the hotel. Sometimes we walked into the city area, sometimes we caught the tram and we got taxis at night, cost was between 9-12 Euro for taxis. I think a taxi from the airport is about 35 Euro. You can hire biked from the hotel for 15 Euro for 24 hours and I highly recommend this. It's lots of fun and Amsterdam is well set up for riding bikes. If you are going to visit Anne Frank house buy tickets online first to avoid long queues...we did this and walked straight in! About 9 Euro. Only issue we had was that we had no hot water on the last morning we were there so couldn't have showers. They offered us to shower in another room but we didn't have time. Overall, would recommend this to others and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place nice situation”
Reviews.Author: YvanDuvan
Reviews.Content: Their was some work during my stay in the hotel, and so some noise, but the reception was helpful and the room well done.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect little place :-)”
Reviews.Author: Sarah-Janexx
Reviews.Content: Vondel Park Plaza is a brill hotel. Its just out of Amsterdam about 7 mins on a tram but the tram stop is litterally a 1 minute walk and the tram ride to Dam Square is good because of the scenery on the way. When we got to the hotel, the room looked more like it was for one person. The bed had 1 single cover on it so I just went to reception and asked for a bigger quilt. The room was tiny but really really cosy, not so good if your with a friend and like your own space though. It was literally 1 room with a glass panel room with a gap at the top for the bathroom. Amsterdam itself is great. I went with my boyfriend and I was a bit worried naked women would be all of the place and fair enough, in the red light district theres alot of woman in windows and they bang on the window when you walk past trying to get your attention but prostitution is legal in Amsterdam and they are only doing there job I suppose!! You cant really go to Amsterdam and moan about stuff like that because it is their way of life. On the other hand Amsterdam is a pretty romantic place and I would definatley recommend going their with a partner or friends. I would definaltey stay at this hotel again. It was lovely and cosy.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT - EXCEEDED OUR EXPECTATIONS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LJ_2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights before Christmas with my partner and another couple (all aged 25-30). On arrival we were early and the gentleman at reception was only too happy to book us in there and then. Our first impressions were excellent! Most Hotels at this price in Amsterdam our quite basis so we had this in mind before arriving. The first room we were allocated, to be honest, had a really bad musty smell but was very clean. I decided to mention it to reception and straight away they were apologising and upgraded us to an executive room on the 6th floor. The room: Wow, spacious clean and an amazing view. The first room allocated to us would have been more than adequate less the smell. We requested an extra pillow on our way out for dinner on the 1st night, On our return we had a pilow in a dry cleaning bag waiting at the door - Now that's what I all service!! The location is fantastic - very quiet and a nice residential area. As said before on other reviews, Tram 2 takes you from the hotel to Leisdeplein, Dam Square etc. And you can buy 3 day passes at great prices. The day before we were meant to leave we decided we did not need a linen change (rooms cleaned every day!!) We left a do not disturb sign on the door and when we returned later in the evening, there was a dry cleaning bag full of fresh towels for us. The bathroom issue was very amusing especially whilst the four of us were having drinks before we headed out each evening! You get used to it after the first day!! haha. Dont know how I would feel though if we were not all as close of friends!! The service at this hotel is fantastic and I would recommend it for anyone travelling to Amsterdam. The staff are so friendly and were great at showing us where the supermarket etc was. Will definately be staying at this hotel on our next visit to Amsterdam! Well done Park Plaza Vondelpark!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fatastic hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Boom_Shankar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a bit away from Leidsplien but tram no 2 takes you door to door and the hotel is comfortably located in the posh side of town along vondelpark.... Great rooms try and get upgraded to the executive rooms with a balcony...they have nespresso makers in the rooms-very nice touch... Dont completely agree with the glass bathrooms...but the rooms were refurbished to very high standards.... Had a couple of drinks in the bar and the staff were really very helpful... Only complaint no wi-fi in the annex building.....:-(

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location next to park, bit further out from city”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla25
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel with good hot shower to defrost from the freezing winter temperatures. Was a bit hard to find as it's about 7-8 stops from Centraal (3/4 from Leidsplein) and the entrance is not showy. The room was smaller than anticipated for a "Superior" but clean and fit for purpose including the useful coffee making facilities. The park is about 2 minutes walk away where it's a nice walk through the park to Leidsplein (20mins) though you should stop in the cafe/restaurant under the film museum for a hot chocolate and to take in the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; fairly good location but fairly expensive”
Reviews.Author: jimster99
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant good quality mid-range business class hotel with friendly staff in a fairly central location - although not right in the centre (about 2 miles south of it in fact) but within walking distance and with a tram stop right outside. I booked directly on the hotel website on the day for â‚¬92 including breakfast. For most cities this hotel would be fairly overpriced for what you get; however Amsterdam is an expensive city and it was a last-minute New Years eve booking so it was about as good as could be got. The rooms are pleasant and comfy with good equipment (including free Nespresso coffee machines, flat screen tvs with a good number of english channels and modern decor). There is a problem which some people would find unacceptable; the bathrooms have transparent, see-through walls so if you will be sharing with someone that you would be embarrassed to see (or hear!!) you using the toilet or shower, I would look elsewhere. The lobby is a little less impressive but still good, with friendly staff and a free internet computer. The rooms are individually designed as the first room we were allocated had a double bed whereas we needed twins and the second room had a totally different floor plan and layout. The twin beds themselves were not that great as they are just single beds. The location of the hotel is pretty good, in a nice quiet residential district on the edge of the city centre about 2 miles south of the train station (which is the at the heart of the city) and a 20 minute walk west of the Van Gough museum and the Rijks museum. A tram stop is right outside. However, it's not right in the heart of the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint-hearted!”
Reviews.Author: Gracie099
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights including New Year's Eve and chose the hotel as it fell in to the price range we could afford and looked great on their website. We booked 2 superior doubles, and were allowed to check in 2 and 1/2 hours early which we were pleased about. However, it was only after our friends contacted reception as their light switch was hanging off the wall and they were subsequently moved to a 'superior room' that we realised we had been given standard ones initially. Our friends had to argue their case to change rooms as reception were not happy to move them, so we decided to grin and bear ours. The bathroom situation is pretty undignified, and only the centre section is frosted, leaving very little to the imagination. There is also a large gap at the top of the glass, which allows bathroom noises etc to be fully heard! Not exactly suitable for a romantic break, and pretty humiliating for your other half! Our room was on the 4th floor, and there does seem to be a foul smell of drains/mould permeating throughout, which never really went away. The towels were changed regularly, and overall the beds and facilities were fine. This hotel is easily walkable to Leidesplein, where we chose to head for New Year, but would be a struggle for Dam Square etc as the trams stopped at 8pm. Having been to Amsterdam before and stayed at the Bellevue which was great, I would say that overall this hotel is average, and would probably be fine if travelling solo, but I definitely wouldn't recommend it to a new couple or those who value their dignity! On the plus side, however, Amsterdam itself was Amazing for New Year's Eve and was one of the most amazing and romantic firework displays I have ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service”
Reviews.Author: rah_baby
Reviews.Content: We decided to have city break for 3 nights just before Christmas, we were a bit exhausted upon arrival due to our flights being delayed by 5hrs because of the snow. Prior to our arrival I emailed them to confirm that we had booked a double bed, I printed off their confirmation incase there were any problems. In reception I confirmed that we had booked a double bed, they had no record of this so I pulled out my email to confirm their response. We got to our room which which was in the building next door to the main reception and found that it was a twin, I took us back down to reception and requested another room, we then went up to this which was in the building adjacent to reception, this room did have a double bed but reeked of block drains, back down again to reception, the duty manager then personally took me to another 2 rooms and I was upgraded to the business suite which was absolutely fantastic, I have to say that getting a double bed was an issue and when you do get one there are 2 twin duvets on the bed, according to the manager this is throughout the hotel. Despite requesting room changes the management were friendly and professional throughout and fantastically accomodating. I do think this had a lot to do with the fact that I had proof that they had let me down initially. So my advise is that if you do confirm anything via email print it off. I have stayed at this hotel previously and found the breakfast was completely over priced and so are drinks from reception costing â‚¬3, We did not choose to eat breakfast at the hotel there is a bakery down the road and a supermarket around the corner and there are fridges in your room were you can keep drinks cool. Our stay was very pleasant and would stay here again. If you are looking for a balance of quiet evenings and city life during the day (a short tram 2 journey away) then this is the location for you.

Reviews.Title: “Quite happy with it”
Reviews.Author: ImazoidWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights recently. Had one of the executive suites which was located in the building next door, these are probably quite different from the rooms in the main building. The room was large by European standards, and yes we had the frosted glass wall separating the bathroom from the rest of the room. Can't say it bothered us particularly but I can understand why some would find it a little offputting as very little is left to the imagination. The water pressure was excellent, and it's probably the most powerful shower I've come across in our travels around Europe. The tub, while not jetted, was a very nice size. Nice firm bed, it was two twins pushed together though. Don't get too excited by the cooler you'll find in these suites, they aren't particularly effective and if you want to chill your drinks you'll be needing ice, which you get direct from the bar when it's open, otherwise the front desk staff will get it for you, to my knowledge there are no ice making machines. The breakfast was included in our hotel rate, and is nothing special, but is an OK way to fill up for the morning. If you leave it too late though you may find that the selection of warm food is limited...and even then the warm stuff isn't exactly piping hot. I have nothing but praise for the front desk staff, any questions we had were answered in a very friendly and efficient manner, and we were always greeted with a smile. One note of caution, when you arrive at the hotel you will notice the only way in is via a couple of staircases which is a bit of a pain when lugging suitcases around. Location wise if you plan to walk to the attractions this hotel is not very convenient. I would guess it's about a 20 - 30 mins walk to the main museums, which is fine if the weather is good, but not so fine if it's cold and wet. It would be a good idea to master the tram system as the number 2 tram runs pass the hotel, the nearest stop is less than 5 mins away. Bear in mind though that if you plan on staying out late, the trams finish up quite early, then you'll be looking at the expensive taxis. The area around the hotel is very residential and you will find a few restaurants/shops in some of the surrounding streets, overall though it is very quiet. Anyway overall I was quite happy with this hotel, and would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Beardam
Reviews.Content: As others had commented, there was a distinctly terrible smell in the hotel that must have been sewer gas during half of my stay. Because the staff was pleasant and because I spent very little time in the hotel, I didn't bother to "raise a stink". The hotel is convenient to nothing and served by only one tram. I have been to Amsterdam many times and it it's VERY easy to get VERY lost in this area ("the Old South"). If you just must stay there, be very careful to exit tram 2 at Emmastraat. Look at the maps in the tram and listen and watch for the stop to be displayed. Be sure to signal the stop if you are the only one exiting. When you exit at Emmastraat, you can turn 5 ways(!) and only one is right. Exit the tram and stay on the street with the tram tracks and keep heading in the direction your tram was. There is no sign protruding from the building and the street keeps curving to the right. You need to carefully watch the front of the buildings because the hotel's sign is flat on the building. Otherwise you will walk right past the hotel. Once you finally figure it out, it's a piece of cake. One wrong turn and you are in for a seemingly endless wander. Better yet, don't bother!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: AlisonNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, well located for tram to city and walking distance to major galleries.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for good room”
Reviews.Author: san_aira
Reviews.Content: In general, we enjoyed our stay at the Park Plaza Vondelpark. The hotel/rooms did not blow us away, but it was a good room for a good price. Positive: - Nice staff - Flat screen tv in the room - Fair price - Metro station nearby: 20min to go to the centre Negative: - breakfast is way too expensive (17â‚¬). As students, we couldn't afford this, so we had to buy breakfast in town. - toilet in the room only separated by a not-see-through-glass. Not very romantic if you can hear each other go to the toilet... - the room was rather small - I hoped for a view on the park, but we just saw a big wall

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lovely part of town”
Reviews.Author: RubyV28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was much better than expected, having read the reviews. I stayed here for 3 nights in a twin room with my sister, and the bathroom was perfectly normal - no glass cubicles in the room or anything! The hotel is located on a pleasant road with shops nearby. The tram stop is outside the hotel and Tram 2 gets you in to Leidseplein in 5 minutes or so (5 stops) - it's only a 10-15 minute walk too. The reception staff were very helpful and knowledgable, made us feel very welcome. The only gripe I had was that the rooms were quite dusty - they need to be cleaned far more thoroughly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: reviewerBirmingham
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Latminute.com. It is one of their "secret hotels" which I thought would be fun, the overview was embellished. The hotel was a tram ride away from anywhere worth visiting, which wouldn't be so bad if it was a nice hotel. I have stayed in many hotel's in many different European Cities including previous visits to Amsterdam and this was definitely the worst. The corridor to the rooms reminded me of something off cell block H and the room was tidy but very very basic and unattractive. I would have been better booking a cheap room in a hostel in the centre. My booking was for a superior room overlooking the garden. There was nothing superior about the room and it overlooked a busy, noisy road, hence my extreme disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, stylish in beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: citybreakstar
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a great location. Rooms are modern and well appointed....safe, hairdryer, tea & coffee, powerful shower, quiet and efficient air con, and unbelievably comfy beds. The bathroom is a frosted glass walled section within the room....not a problem if staying with a long term partner but could be a little embarassing in other circumstances ! Did not have breakfast....pricey at 17.50 Euros. Best option is to use the back entrance , cross the road into the park and keep right. Cross the little blue footbridge and you will come to a large circular cafe .....takes 10 minutes tops. Here you can get croissants, brownies, muffins and good coffee and a selection of teas...and sandwiches after 11am. Location is fine......don't be put off by the distance from the centre. Trams run every few minutes and the no. 2 stops just 200 metres before the hotel and has you into town in 10 to 20 minutes depending on where you hop off. Best value for a few days is to buy a public transport travel pass from the tourist info shop directly opposite Arrivals 2. These are available in multiples of 24 hours and cover trams bus and metro.....a separate return train ticket to cental station comes in with the price. A 96 hour pass costs 23 Euros. This proved excellent value as we used it to jump on and off trams all weekend. Top tips for eats drinks smokes sights are .......Rusland coffeeshop, American Hotel cafe, Ist Class cafe on platform 2B Central Station, Tuschinski Theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cazzer1962
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights and had a very relaxng time. The hotel is a little far out of the centre but only 15 minutes on the regular tram. We walked one day as it was a lovely day, it was a very pleasant 1 hour stroll through the vondelpark and the Liedesplein centre where the museums are. The room was very clean and comfortable. The only gripe We had was that our room was right next to the lift and everytime it was used we could hear it going up and down and stopping with a clunk which woke us up several times. Didn't bother with breakfast as at 17 euros it is extortionate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but "interesting" bathroom”
Reviews.Author: fcsklabrie
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel near Vondelpark. Tram 2 goes from centraal station to the hotel in 15 mins. Reception employees gave basic info, not very proactive. Bar was under renovation during our 4 day stay, and we opted out of 17 euro breakfast. Room was on third floor, facing a courtyard. Was quiet, good size and equipped with mini fridge, free safe and free wi-fi. Only draw-back was the interesting bathroom. Part of the room is set aside by a transparent cube of glass open at top, and that is only partly frosted. So when you go to bathroom, your partner can see your feet and can hear any noises you make. Not recommended for new couples or friends, for that reason :) Other than that, definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place - thanks to reviews on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: NYCdesi
Reviews.Content: Thanks to this wonderful site, I narrowed down my selection to the ones on TripAdvisor's best values and snared a great value packet (air + this hotel) thru travelocity. My room was on the fourth floor in the building next to the main one; it was very very clean and quite nice. The bathroom was a bit strange as others had outlined. Couldn't figure out why there was only half a door in the shower. But it was a very minor irritance. Location was right on road where the tram 2 runs. Tram stop is about 2 minutes walk and so hotel's location made it extremely convenient for quick travel into the Dam (17 mts), Centraal (20 mts) or Spui (15 mts). Train service was also very prompt and I don't remember waiting for more than 10 mts. Note that hotel is right on the tram line, there are no restaurants or grocery stores nearby. Since the hotel breakfast was a stiff 17 euros, my girlfriend and I frequently had our b/fast or brunch only later during the day in the city. I think that this hotel can easily pass off as a 4star hotel and would highly recommend it. I certainly plan to come back here again when I come next. :) tip 1 - we regularly purchased water, snacks and sandwiches at the Albert Heijn dept store near the Spui and stored them in the fridge along with my many beer bottles. ;) tip 2 - check out the Indonesian take-out place @ the Spui on the way to the hotel. It is called "Il Kantige and Detigie". Very tasty and affordable that you can bring it back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Option in Amsterdam near the Park and Museums”
Reviews.Author: Raeleanne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park Plaza Vondelpark for one night in September of 2009. We arrived around lunch time after a transatlantic flight and were exhausted. Thankfully our room was ready and we were able to check in right away. We had booked and paid for the room already on the Park Plaza website and check in went very smoothly. Our room was in a different building than the reception area and we had a little difficulty finding it since the room numbering did not make much sense to our sleep deprived, jet lagged brains. But eventually we found it without having to go back and ask for assistance. We were very impressed with the accommodations. We had seen pictures on the hotel website as well as on trip advisor and everything lived up to expectation. The bed was comfortable, the washroom was clean and the shower had good water pressure. Even though our room was on street level we did not hear any noise from the street at all. We did not hear any noise from the room next to ours either, with the exception that they seemed to come and go from their room a lot and we could hear the door opening and closing. There was however noise when they were in their room and we were not really troubled by the door noises. The only other concern we had while staying at the Park Plaza Vondelpark was that the shower did not drain properly. We did not make a complaint to the front desk and I forgot to mention it on check out. It was not a huge concern but we did have to use towels to keep shower water from running through the bathroom and out into the room. Overall our stay was very good. The location was fairly close to two street car stops and we were able to get around the city with ease. We would definitely consider staying here again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and very cheerful”
Reviews.Author: hotlipsvix
Reviews.Content: Once we worked out that if you cut through the vondel park we were 10 mins from the centre we were more than happy! a pleasant walk and it was nice to see the locals in the park. The rooms were small but i couldnt fault them in any other way. The location was great as 10 mins to the centre but also easy to get to and from the different areas of the city. i would stay here again as the price was so much cheaper than most of the city hotels and the rooms better than cheaper city hotels. The walk was nice. The rooms small but no problem. No noise or disturbance. Over all good value for money. Staff also were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean for a great price”
Reviews.Author: AUtravelerinTX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at this hotel and were very pleased to stay in a part of town that was quiet and safe but less than 2 minutes on the tram to all attractions. The hotel was very clean and modern and we thought it was an excellent value. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel should be a four star instead of three. Skip the breakfast, it was 17 EU/person.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: coldbacon
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Amsterdam, I booked a flight + hotel package on lastminute.com. After browsing through a number of hotels on the site, I came upon the Park Plaza, the pictures showed a modern looking hotel and after checking reviews around the net, I decided to give it a go. On arrival to Amsterdam Central Station, it only took us 1 tram - No. 2 to get to the hotel on Emmastraat. The location is excellent as No.2 tram goes around all the main touristy places and the nearby area is quite upmarketly residential, and so was rather safe. The only nag I have is that there are no supermarkets/corner shops anywhere near the hotel, so if you need anything eg. drinks/snacks etc... make sure you get them in town before returning to the hotel as the refridgerator in the room is not stocked at all. The room we got was in the annex building with 2 balconies and the room turned out to look even better than the pictures on the website with modern design, very clean beds and the bathroom is equally well kept. We were supplied with the usual - shower gel/shampoo/lotion etc, with bedroom slippers; a safe; hairdryer; coffee maker with ample coffee/tea supplies. The only thing that made my stay less than perfect was that one of the balcony door's handle was broken so we weren't able to open that particular door. After informing the front desk about it within 5 minutes of arriving in the room and was told that they'd send someone to check it out, they never did and the door was never fixed. However the other balcony was more than enough for us so we weren't too bothered about the second, front facing balcony in the end. Overall, a very good stay and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel should be a 4-stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nitronite
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located at the south end of the Vondel Park, behind a lake, the area is very quiet, the tram is only 100 meters away, 6 minutes to the center. the most helpful crew, extremely nice location, the room is spacy with a tinted glass bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Loved The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Becksybaby
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel.... the rooms were modern, really nicely decorated & we weren't bothered by the bathroom at all (see photo's for what it is!) Gorgeous power shower & decent hairdryer in room, comfy beds, black out curtains & a nice quiet location in a decent area. Easy to get tram 2 from just a 2min walk away (although it is walkable if you want to walk into town) It is right next door to the beautiful Vondelpark & also very close to the Van Gogh museum. Breakfast was an extra 17 euro's per peson so we gave that a miss! Would definitely stay here again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, expensive breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: eco55
Reviews.Content: We loved the location in a quiet and elegant residential district. It was only a few stops on the tram and Leidesplein was walkable in 20 minutes. Staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. On the negative side, there was only a buffet breakfast available for 17 euros which meant we had to trek out each morning for breakfast. Our room was at the front of the hotel which meant that when the trams began to run at 6am, there was noise and vibrations felt in the room every 20 mins. Internet access was very limited with a poor connection but on the whole, I would stay there again simply for the gorgeous location next to the stunning Vondelpark.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay - great location next to the park”
Reviews.Author: S_S
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza Vondelpark was easy to get to; just a few minutesâ€™ walk from the #2 tram stop. Itâ€™s also located a short walk away from the Vondelpark which we visited several times. We had booked a triple room online and later even converted to a better rate during a sale. The room had an entry way where the single bed was placed and in the other side of the room was the double bed, so there was a bit more privacy than the usual roll in cot hotels setup for kids. Our 3rd floor room overlooked the street, and there was some street car noise, but not too intrusive. The room also came with a small fridge and coffee/tea setup, which came in handy for storing food for our picnic in the park. The bathroom was nice and clean and new, although it had a weird cloudy glass door which revealed too much about who was using the bathroom â€“ not sure why they didnâ€™t just install an opaque door. We used the free internet terminal in the lobby to contact our families, there was also wireless available in the lobby. The staff was friendly and helped us get a taxi and find a restaurant in the area. Overall, a great experience, I can especially recommend the location which was quiet and non-touristy as well as close to the park for families. We didnâ€™t have a chance to spend much time at this, but there were more nice looking non-touristy restaurants and shops along the main street away from the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast, but unacceptable "glass bathroom"”
Reviews.Author: BobTheDog2009
Reviews.Content: Having booked three rooms these comments are the consensus of six people. No matter how good a hotel is, it is just not acceptable to have washing and toilet facilities separated from the "living area" by a partially opaque glass screen that extends only to withing 25 cm of the ceiling. This was the first time any of us had experienced this arrangement, and none of us liked it (see photo). I will add this feature to my hotel checklist to avoid it in the future. The staff were polite and proper but lacked personality. Breakfast was good, and it would be difficult to imagine anyone complaining about it. The location, near to the park, was quiet, with a good tram service to the city centre. The computer allocated for guest use was old and slow, and not attached to a printer. Various aspects of the setup lead me to believe that the corporate IT Management leave a lot to be desired. It was not my idea of a 2009 setup.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, far enough from city centre to avoid the rowdy noise!”
Reviews.Author: lickylonglips
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 11 nights from August 5th to 16th. We had a superior twin room, apparently, although I think this actually wasn't the case. The hotel is located a short 2 minute walk from the tram stop at Emmastraat, which is served by tram 2. Or, if you walk to the other side of Emmastraat, you can catch the line 16. The trams are generally every 10 minutes throughout the day. Beware, if you need to be at central station early on a Sunday morning to catch the train to Schipol, the first tram then is at 07:05. We had a rush to make it for our 8 a.m. check-in! Check-in is strictly at 2 pm. We arrived slightly early and waited in the comforatable lounge area, where we watched the Flintstones on the TV. The lifts in the hotel are small, but being on the 2nd floor (actually the 1st floor as far as I could tell - it was the florr above reception!) we hardly used it apart from taking luggage up to the room and bringing it back down again. There is a computer with internet access, but this is generally taken, whatever time of the day or night (even at 2 a.m.!) you try, so I would suggest you bring your own laptop and take advantage of the free wireless internet. The room was very small with 2 single beds next to each other. So near to each other they were touching. As two friends travelling together, we had to rearrange the room slightly so that we weren't essentially "sharing a bed". The beds were comfortable with one pillow and a duvet. The room had a bowl of fruit and two bottles of water, which was a nice tough. There was also a kettle with a selection of teas and coffees. The hot drinks were topped up sporadically over our stay, although the maid for some reason seems to think that I like earl grey, as she kept leaving more and more of it, even though I never touched it! The TV in the room is wall-mounted and the main channels of interest to an English-speaker are BBC, BBC2 and Comedy Central. It is a little high on the wall, however, and you do end up with a crick in your neck from watching it. The air conditioning is a godsend and was lovely after a long day sightseeing in the clammy heat! The bathroom has a frosted glass door, so make sure you're aware that people in your room could see you sitting on the toilet! Shampoo, showel gel, body lotion, soap, etc are provided should you need them. The towels were replaced every day if needed. The shower had a gap down the middle of the door which meant that the bathroom floor was permanently swimming in water. The whole 11 day stay, the bed linen was not changed once. The pillow was plumped and the duvet folded, but the actual duvet cover, pillow case and sheet were left. The hotel is 2 minutes walk from Vondelpark, which is a must. Check out the free classical concerts on a Sunday afternoon. You can reach Leidseplein in 7 minutes on the tram and Centraal Station in 14. There are lots of restaurants near the hotel on Emmastraat and Willems Parkweg, but we didn't try them, preferring instead to eat near Leidseplein. Be aware that if you are out late at night, the last tram is around 00:30 and after that the night buses takes over. If you take the night bus, I would suggest the 358 and getting off at Museumplein, which is the nearest stop to the hotel (and a 12-15 minute walk at that, but it's a very safe area). If you decided to get a taxi from Centraal Station / Damrak / REd Light area, expect to pay around 14 euros at least....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Pickywitch
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in a quiet upmarket residential area a short tram ride to the main attractions, trams are every 10 minutes or so and the nearest stop is less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel. There are a varied selection of good restaurants within very easy walking distance. Hotel staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful, without exception. Some areas of the hotel are a little tired but all are spotlessly clean. Beware of the fact that in some rooms the bathroom is screened off from the rest of the room only by glass panels which do not go all the way to the ceiling. The bed was fantastically comfortable and the room had plenty of space for the two of us. We were slightly disappointed that the fruit and bottled water were not replenished each day when the room was serviced. Breakfast provided a wide choice and was nicely presented, however I'm not sure that I would have liked to have paid 17 euros which I believe is the going rate if it's not included in the room rate. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food. We had one drink from the bar and paid around the price we would expect from a city hotel - 4.50 euro for a glass of house wine. Free wi-fi is available in the hotel lobby and there is also a PC available for guest use. Vondelpark is beautiful - well worth making time to have a wander around if the weather is kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: 2572dave
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great with great service from the reception staff. A little out of the way (30 min walk from city centre) although the number 2 tram does run right outside the hotel. Vondelpark is right behind the hotel and great for a walk and lovely scenary. Rooms a small but suitable for short stays

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: jimmylonghurst
Reviews.Content: Booked in on Friday 31/07/2009, the hotel is not in the centre and takes about 7 minute tram(2) ride from Leidseplein to get there, this tram stops on Emmastraat and the hotel is just around the corner. Nice welcome in the reception and up to the room, this is where it goes wrong a bit. Getting out of the lift the carpet was all stained and the paint on the doors all chipped and painted a horrible bright pink. The room itself was on the small side and the bathroom tiny. More carpet stains on the carpet but the room was very clean otherwise. The TV is located high up the wall so that to watch it you 'crick' your neck. Overnight traffic could be heard. We didn't have breakfast there but ate at the Melkhuis in th Vondelpark which was lovely. The sheer matter that it was so far out of town would put me off staying there again. The bar is cosy, and free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “If you love mildew, this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug8
Reviews.Content: We had to hold our breath in the hallways for the two days we spent here. I don't know if there had been a flood recently or what, but the hallways smelled so badly that a deep breath could make you retch. No explanation or apology was given for the smell and we tried to spend as little time in the hotel as possible in order to get away from it. If we hadn't pre-paid the room, we would have left. The room itself was small, but adequate. The bathroom was weird, as it was literally in the room itself, separated by a glass wall. That meant that if one of us had to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, they would unintentionally wake up the other person. Housekeeping changed the linens and emptied the trash, but did not tidy up or appear to vacuum. On the upside, the hotel was in a great location for us, just off of the Vondelpark. The area is nice and quiet when you want to sleep and there is a tram stop just a few minutes away that will take you right into the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and quiet location nearby the wonderful park”
Reviews.Author: nowe_rozdanie
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this place. It is located a bit further from the city center, but we didn't find it a problem at all. It takes 15 minut to get by foot to Leidesplein and another 10-15 minutes to Dam Square. As part of the walk can be done through the gorgeous Vondelpark, it makes the walk very pleasant. To tired to take a walk? You can always take a tram passing through a couple of major sights such as Museum District, Leidesplein, canals, Dam Square reaching finally Centraal Station. Hotel properties are divided into a couple of stylish buildings. We stayed in room #554 overlooking the backstreet that leads almost directly to the park entrance. Room itself was big enough for two of us, perfectly clean and quiet. The bathroom is a highlight of its own, as is spacious and has glass walls what makes it look extremely modern. If you can be right in the middle of the action of the crazy city center, that may not be the perfect spot. But if you appreciate to stay in the quiet upscale neighbourhood, but still within walking distance to the major sights of Amsterdam, make a booking here. Not mentioning a short, up to 10 minutes taxi ride from the airport that will cost you 30-35 Euro. The last but not least, they charged us approx. 95 Euro per night for 4 night stay, what seems to be pretty good value for money concerning hotel's location and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, stylish, close to Museum Quarter, good price”
Reviews.Author: dealphile
Reviews.Content: Got a nice little package for this hotel for me and my friend at Priceline. It's on a quiet street, right beside the Vondelpark. Great location, close to Museum Quarter, quiet, decent size compared to most European hotels of the same quality. Clean and tidy, modern furnishings, cute fixtures and bath. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “two extremely happy travelers”
Reviews.Author: bur03
Reviews.Content: beautiful neighborhood, across from a fantastic park and trams. the front desk always helpful and going beyond what was expected............the breakfast area each morning was immaculate and cheeses, meats, breads, etc. fresh and presented beautifully.there as well the service was wonderful.......our room was lovely and always made up to perfection......we did not want to leave ............

Reviews.Title: “Small, but comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Maxxzoom
Reviews.Content: Before traveling to Amsterdam, I knew I had to check Trip Advisor for a Hotel Recommendation and the review were right on the money. The hotel is just outside the crazness that is downbtown Amsterdam so you don't have to worry about having that sort of thing right outside your bedroom window. It is however just a short tram right (10 minutes) from the thick of things. The rooms are small, but comfortable. A big TV sits high on the wall and a chair by the window brought us a good view of the unique, somewhat upscale neighborhood. Having the largest and nicest park in town behind the hotel was great for a morning jog. The breakfast buffet was fresh and despite the powdered eggs, it was quite good. I don't think you can beat it for the price (averaged about 85 Euro per night. Not much to say negitivley about the Hotel other then a few last comments about the surrounding area. The parking is very difficult as you just have to get lucky getting a spot even near the hotel (no Hotel Parking what-so-ever). Also I had to pay about 6 Euro for only two hours! Luckily we were there on a Saturday night through Monday morning as you only have to pay 9-7 Mon-Sat. Also you must have a good map of the city to get around. You can get quickly turned around if you havn;'t been there before. Certainly by the end of a few days there, you will start to catch on. I would definately go back to The Park Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but limited internet”
Reviews.Author: Pickles
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night before going to the airport; the location is great if you have a car because the airport is 15 minutes away and there is plenty of parking, which is free after 19:00 and on Sundays. Our upgraded room was in the second building and was large, modern and pleasant. We walked to the museums and enjoyed being in a quiet, attractive and safe area away from the hubbub of the center. We have two complaints about the hotel. The first is that the only internet available was one terminal in the main lobby; this seemed particularly odd given that our room was clearly a businessperson's suite. The other is the price of the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: cookie5825
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, slightly far out of centre. Very clean comfortable and warm. Good breakfasts but rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, good value for money with helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Scotpad
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days in Amsterdam staying at this Hotel. Very good value for money, set in nice quiet residential location but only 7 or so stops from Dam Square. Tram no. 2 within very short distance from hotel. Hotel staff friendly & helpful.Room although quite small adequate for a short stay. Quite expensive in town though, with the low exchange rate of the Euro!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leighann912
Reviews.Content: We upgraded when we arrived for 20 Euro and were greeted with a very spacious room, spotless, which opened on to a garden area. Right our the back is Vondel Park, a beautiful park for walking, people and animal watching. It's a block away from the number 2 tram stop and we never waited more than 5 minutes for a tram to arrive. The desk staff was gracious and helpful. Breakfast was fresh, tasty and plentiful with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, rolls, bread, croissants, fresh fruit, orange and passionfruit juices, hot tea, cocoa and coffee. This was included in the cost of our room, though it is extra with some packages. We also received a wonderful bowl of fresh delicious fruit and a bottle of wine which we paired with a couple of rolls from breakfast and took into town with us for a lunch by the canel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice neighborhood hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeminiTraveler
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here in March. The front desk staff was awesome. They were able to get us into a room in the morning as opposed to making us wait for the regular check in time. We stayed in the outer buidling and our room was fantastic. It reminded me of a small apartment in regards to the layout. This hotel was within walking distance to Vondelpark and it's situated in a very quite residential neighborhood with easy access to public transportation and only minutes away to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Good value stay!”
Reviews.Author: RonJulia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Plaza Hotel near Vondelpark in Amsterdam over the Easter weekend in April 2009. We found that it was best to get a taxi from Schipol to the hotel....35 euros for the 4 of us was quick (our plane had been delayed for an hour) and actually cheaper than the mini-buses touting for trade in the airport. The hotel is in a quiet part of Amsterdam next to the Vondelpark - it is within walking distance of the Van Gogh museum, we went to see the exhibition 'Van Gogh and the Colours of the Night'........excellent - make sure you pre-book online to avoid too much queuing....same goes for Anne Frank's House. The ordinary queue was horrendously long!! All of the other attractions of Amsterdam are in easy reach from the hotel...usually via the number 2 tram which goes from near to it. The hotel bedrooms were very clean, well serviced...with air-con, tea making facilities, safe, empty mini-fridge, good sized wall-mounted flat screen TV, excellent shower...electric sockets which take UK plugs with no need for an adaptor. Breakfast is quite pricey at 15 euros, but has a good selection of grub...scrambled egg, bacon, mini sausages, fruit salad, croissants, bread, cheese, hametc. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Very close to the hotel is a good Italian restaurant - Bella Vista and a Tapas Bar, Tapa Feliz...we tried both.... they both served good food and were very conveient to the hotel. Amsterdam itself was a delight...we have been to Amsterdam a few times over the years and when we came a few years ago, we thought it had got a bit rough.....however it was very relaxed and good humoured on this trip. Long may this continue in a city, which like its people, are very friendly to the British!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to tram stop”
Reviews.Author: TravelLowdown
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the Vondelpark Park Plaza for 2 nights during our recent trip to Amsterdam for an international football (soccer) match. Amsterdam is an expensive city, moreso due to the poor GBP - Euro exchange rate (a pint of Heineken and a pint of lemonade was over 10Euros!) and finding a reasonably priced hotel was tricky. Vondelpark Park Plaza fitted the bill. We arrived in Amsterdam by train and purchased a stripenkaarten at a newsagent at the Station Centraal. Taking tram 2, we alighted at Emmastraat, the nearest tram stop to the hotel, and walked the 100metres or so to the hotel. We were warmly welcomed at the hotel and our luggage deposited at the left luggage room as we had arrived before check-in. We took a walk into the city centre, walking as far as Leidsplein, which took around 30mins at a reasonable pace (so i assume that Station Centraal would have been another 15-20mins walk). Plus points about our room + satellite tv (although limited channels) + comfortable bed (two twins pushed together, which allowed us to feel that we were not in the same bed) with comfortable pillows and douvet + window that opened + clean Negative points - ineffective air conditioning (minimum temperature of 18C) - excessive street noise due to tram line outside window (trams run from around 6am to just after midnight) - poor blackout effect from curtains - ineffectual double glazing We did not eat in the hotel restaurant for any meals. There is a computer for guest use in the hotel lobby, but neither of us made use of this, so I am unsure of any expense to utilise it. With regards amsterdam, it is possible to book tickets for many museums online (including the Anne Frank, Van Gogh and Heineken museums) which is recommended as the queues can be lengthy to purchase tickets, especially at the Van Gogh museum. We did not eat at any recommendation worthy restaurants during my trip, but did make use of the supermarkets (Albert Heijn) for purchasing cold beers, soft drinks, snacks and items for picnics. Stripenkaarten are also available at the tobacco kiosks in the supermarkets. The red light district made for an interesting evening stroll / window shopping, although there was more than just an occasional suspicious character hanging around, so I would only take essential items, avoid taking bags and keep things in front pockets. With regards stripenkaarten, they cost 7.30Euros for 15 strips and provide better value for money than buying individual tickets for each trip. To use the public transport it costs one strip plus one strip for every zone you are travelling in (eg travel within one zone costs 2 strips per person, travel within 2 zones costs 3 strips, etc). 2 strips gets you around most of amsterdam on all forms of public transport (metro, trams and buses), including from Station Centraal to Emmastraat, and can be used throughout the country, as we managed to use it in Eindhoven at the end of our trip. Multiple people can use the same stripenkaarten as long as the appropriate number of strips have been stamped for each person travelling (ie 4 strips for 2 people travelling within zone 1). The strips allow you unlimited travel within that zone using as many forms of public transport as necessary for a 1 hour period. If I was to return to Amsterdam, I would probably look for a hotel further back from the main tram lines due to the noise they produce.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sandman8888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated right next to Vondelpark, which is a great location, in my opinion . . . you wouldn't want to stay right in the city centre or in/around the red light district . . . it's noisy and congested there . . . this hotel is off the tourist spots and in a very good neighborhood . . . it's also a short tram ride away from the city center (tram stop of the hotel is ernstaadt) - the hotel also has a large shower, a biggie in Europe . . . however, it's only separated from the room by frosted glass . . . but if you are with your wife/girlfriend, then it shouldn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: russ90210
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the rude and abrupt lady who checked us in, we had a great stay at the Park Plaza Vondel. All the other staff were excellent in answering our questions, our room was comfortable thanks to the upgrade we received and it was an excellent part of town from which to explore Amsterdam. So we didn't let that lady stop us from having a great time! This place provided us with one of our best stays in Europe - and we really enjoyed Amsterdam thanks to the Park Plaza. Positives: + Close to the tram line number 2 (Emmastraat stop), extremely easy to get to from Amsterdam Centraal + Free Wifi internet + Executive rooms are extremely spacious and well fitted out Negatives: - Glass bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pgmpogues
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Plaza for four nights in March 2009 and found it an ideal base for touring Amsterdam. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was well furnished, clean and very comfortable. Breakfast was as good as anywhere else we have stayed in a European city. Use of the safe in the room was free - something you don't get very often in my experience. There was a coffee maker with a plentiful supply of coffee, milk etc and the hotel bar was well stocked, if a little pricey, but that's probably due, in part, to the pound's weakness against the euro. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good quality, well priced, hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Prema_C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the summer of 2008. The hotel is close to museum square and dam square is accessible by tram which is available right outside the hotel. Though the hotel is on the tram route, it is secluded. The rooms were very clean and the service was good. The breakfast spread was ok. The Vondel park is closeby and a huge park where you can enjoy a leisurely walk. The weather during our stay was very pleasant and we had an enjoyable time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great part of Amsterda,”
Reviews.Author: artigat1
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel that is out of the centre and away from the drunken stag/hen parties. The hotel is small, the rooms are clean and the staff friendly and helpful. It did cost us EUR25 from Central Station in a taxi to get to the hotel though. We walked around the area on the following day though and found we were close to the museums and Heineken Experience and just a short tram ride from the centre of the City. Would definitely recommend the hotel and go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park Plaza Vondel Park”
Reviews.Author: thecaribou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vondel Park Hotel in January 2009 for 4 nights. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Thought it in not in the heart of the city, it is only 10 minute tram ride to the Dam Square, and the tram stop is only a block away from the hotel. (tram no: 22 i think) The rooms are small, as in most hotel rooms in Europe. But it was well furnished, well-stocked and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a grocery store a short walk away, ask the hotel for directions. The only downside for me was the reed thin walls, which would typically not be an issue, but we had a bunch of inconsiderate hotel guests, who kept slamming doors and talking aloud in the hallways late in the night. To the hotel staffâ€™s credit, they did come and warn the guests to stop making noise. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akane1
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel. Why? Not because of any sort of hoity-toity service or amenities, but because it gives you a lot for the price you're paying. What you get: Clean room, privacy, decent space (in my case, I stayed in the adjacent building, 4th floor), comfortable bed, basic furniture. Decent service with excellent English-speaking staff. Close to major tram that will take you right into the city square, about 5 minutes or so. Also close to certain museums like the Van Gogh. Quiet neighborhood ideal for walking. Vondelpark is your backyard!!!!!!!!!!!! Incredibly small bathroon but in my case, I had a completely private bathroom, opaque door, etc. Mini-bar. What you don't get: A central location, over-friendly service (the service is there if you need it but don't expect them to fall over backwards to greet you, smile, etc.), good food/drinks, a lot of noise from the streets, room service. This is a great hotel if you're on a budget, or even if you're not, and staying for some time. You get the nice, quiet streets after a hard day of sight-seeing and noise. Skip the breakfast or any food the hotel serves. There's a fantastic supermarket with everything you will need only a 7-minute walk away. Also, great restaurants on that same street that will do take-away. Get some groceries and some salads, etc. at the take-out places and store them in the mini-bar. A good plus is that you can check your email and surf the web in the hotel lobby for free. The hotel lobby will also arrange for transportation service to the airport or call a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzo68
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with the tram stopping right outside you are in a great location away from the hustle & bustle. There are plenty of nice restaurants within walking distance too, Pulpo being within a 5 min walks and serves great food (The steak is a fave). If you don't fancy breakfast at the hotel which I think is a little pricey if you don't want the full monty, you can turn right out of the hotel and within 5 mins walk you will find a small cafe & bakery. If you want to walk through the Vondel Park there is also a cafe next to the film museum that serves breakfast. The rooms at the hotel are very trendy, if you like privacy when using the bathroom then not ideal but I maintain that this is the best shower you will find in a hotel. The staff are very helpful and always happy. I have stayed at this hotel for business many many times and choose come back here for a romantic weekend with the hubby, it was just as good. Finally dutch food can be hard to find, I recommend Moeders which serves food like your Mum would do if she was Dutch! It's a quirky place with mismatched grocery and pictures of diners Mum's on the wall.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a quiet part of town”
Reviews.Author: usitaly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the south part of Amsterdam and very close to the #2 tram which runs all the way to the very north of the city stopping at the Central Station. The hotel was next to the scenic Vondelpark (hence the name of the hotel). I really enjoyed wandering through looking at the trees, ponds, ducks, etc. on my way to explore the town. The hotel staff was extremely accomodating and everything was clean! We booked a double room and were initially given 2 beds. When we called the front desk to move us to a room with one bed, they did so without hesitation and upgraded us to an executive suite. That's always a plus! The only weird thing, which I had read on other review sites, is that the executive suite has a very non-private bathroom. True! There is no door that actually closes you off from hearing and partially seeing your suitemate use the facilities. Not my thing. Apart from that the beds were very comfortable which can be a hard thing to find in Europe, in my experience. The staff was always attentive and quick. I paid 100 Euro per night on average for the time we were there though that didn't include breakfast. We were happier eating out in whatever cafe we found. so I don't know how the food was there. They also arranged an airport shuttle for us (13 Euro) and had free wi-fi and a computer inthe lobby. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EUHR
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great peacefull part of Amsterdam, just few station from Leidsplein squere. Rooms are good, and clean. I would recomend it for everyone who are on some business trip or for people who are on romantic getaway

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Garinca
Reviews.Content: Room quite small, bathroom too. The buffet breakfast is expensive - costs 17 Euro! Front desk helpful, made a reservation for a small Italian restaurant within a walking distance. For this price it s easy to book much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Plush Plaza”
Reviews.Author: walkingnick
Reviews.Content: Staff on arrival were very friendly and spoke excellent english. Our room was very bright, clean and well furnished. The bathroom was excellent with many extra items such as toiletries to make the stay enjoyable. The towels were changed everyday even after only one use. The queen bed was actually two singles pushed together but i think this is a fairly common practice and no problem. Air conditioning in the room worked well and would be great on a hot day......unfortunately the weather was not great whilst we were there. Our room was facing onto the main street but noise was not a problem with good double glazing. The neighbourhood around the hotel is very quiet and has a nice friendly feeling. Vondelpark is beautiful and well used by the locals for cycling, dog walking etc. Watch out for the parakeets flying around the park. There are lots of restaurants/cafe's in the area and an Albert Hein store down the road in case you need any odd items. Trams run every 10 mins to centraal station on tram line no 2. Buy a strippen kaart at a shop or information centre before you get on the tram. (6.90 Euro's for a 15 strip ticket) If you travel into the centre from the hotel you do not pass through any other zones so you only get two credits stamped off so it makes it a quite cheap and efficient way of getting around. All in all we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Basheba
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Since I was by myself I had a single room with a twin but was happy that it was a very big full-size bed. The comforter was big and fluffly and so were the pillows. My bathroom was spotless (remember that in Europe sometimes, "H" means cold and "C" means hot). I had a decent-sized flat screen television with cable and even got a few English-speaking stations but didn't watch too much TV. There was a hot water tea kettle in the room and they provided coffee and tea packets. While I was there it got very hot and I was glad the room had air conditioning even though the window opened which was also nice. My room was cleaned every day. In the lobby you can purchase sodas and light snacks or get complimentary coffee, espresso, or tea. They also have a computer to use at no charge and newspapers to read. The lobby was very clean also. All the staff I dealt with were very nice and all spoke English. The hotel is in a very quiet section of Amsterdam so you don't have to worry about noise from late-night party people. It is very close to Vondel Park (which is also very nice) and the museum section. It is a VERY short walk to the tram stop which is on the number 2 line which is a straight shot to about everything. Also around the corner a short distance is a small grocery store. I really can't understand the negative reviews; I feel as though there are some people you just can't please. This hotel stacked up to any American hotel. (I've been to Europe before so I know that a hotel there can be a nightmare but this one was great).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: wiandci
Reviews.Content: This was a suprisingly pleasant stay. I was a little nervous walking through the hallways, but when we got into the room it was extremely clean with a large shower. The hotel does not have any parking but we were able to park on the street for 13 Euros per day (a great price for city parking) and since the hotel is in a fantastic neighborhood we weren't worried about the car. It's a bit of a walk from the hotel to get to the sights such as Dam Square, but the tram picks up just around the corner which makes it extremely easy to get around. Staff were exceedingly helpful and breakfast was great more than just continental. Will stay here again if we make it back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Hated The Rodents!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ammochick
Reviews.Content: Oh my God I don't know where to start!!!!! The room was filthy with mould in the bathroom and stains on the bedding!!!!! There was a rodent in the room and to be honest i wasn't sure if it was a rat or a mouse!!!!! Towels not changed!!!! Hidious price for breakfast!!!!! Stinkiing dirty carpets!!!!! We paid for three rooms but upon check out they told us we'd only paid for two rooms!!!! We had proof of confirmation on us and it was only when i threatened to start shouting about the rodent situation that we had things resolved.............eventually!!!! WE only just made it to the airport on time because it took so long and the staff on reception were so arrogant!!!!! I would never visit this hotel again and it has put me off ever going to Amsterdam again!!!!! The reason we went in the first place was to celebrate my parents Ruby anniversary and i don't think any of us expected to be staying in a hostel when they stated it was a four star hotel!!! When booking and paying for room on internet in full we were then told on checkout that only two rooms had been paid for. All I can say is that maybe Stevie Wonder gave this "hostel" a four star rating and perhaps he was having sinus problems at the time so he couldn't smell how stinking it was!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: vikingCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quiet residential area (oud zuid) by vondel park on the edge of the museum area. The rooms are clean, beds comfortable and the tv carries a variety of channels incl. BBC world, CNN and discovery channel. English and us shows are subtitled in dutch. The staff is friendly and helpful. An Albert Hein supermarket is located on the corner of emma straat and J. Verhulst Straat. There are 2 restaurants at this intersection as well. A third restaurant is located on the corner of valerius straat right across from the hotel. At the intersection ef koninginneweg and emma laan the sandwich shop "yours truly" and a couple of other small convenience stores can be found. At the intersection of koninginneweg and amstelveneense weg you can find a bank, post office and a photgraphy shop with one hour service for developement. For a nice restaurant try POMPA at willemsparkweg 6 at the intersection af willemsweg and van baerle straat. In the city try restaurant de spiegel at lijnbaansgracht 277. Be advised there are two small draw backs with regards to this hotel. The location is not central so there is little to do in the evening. If you want to go out you have to go to the city centre. It is easy by tram but trhe trams stop running at midnight so you need a cab to go back and they can be difficult to obtain at night. Second, acces to the lobby is not easy. The stairs are smooth and high and there is no ramp. You have to carry your luggage up a couple of step steps so if you have a difficulty walking this place is not a good choice For transportation tram line no. 2 stops less than 100 meters from the hotel. This line runs through the city center to the central station Good bookstores are waterstones kalverstraat 152 and american book center spui 12. For perfumes and other gifts for wives try leidsstraat 74 - 76. For shopping in general try area around prinsen gracht, keisergracht, leidseplein, spui and dam For transportation and discounts at sights by an amsterdam card You can get it opposit the central station. Great sights are the rijks museum, amsterdam historical museum, canal trip, the amsterdam museum ship (replica of merchant vessel) and the artis zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Try to get a suite”
Reviews.Author: DublinBatman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend and really liked the hotel. Was in a great location and the number 2 tram took you to the centre every 10 mins. Got an upgrade to one of the business suites which was really spacious and had a great jacquizzi in the bath room. The staff were really nice and helpful. Didnt sample the food but there are great places to eat in Amsterdam. Very comfy beds to boot.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but some problems!”
Reviews.Author: pretty_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 5 days in March 2008 while on a business trip in amsterdam.
