The neighborhood is out of the city center area but two tram stops 2 and 16 are closeby to get you to the city center in 15-20 minutes. tram 2 stop is a block away and tram 16 stop is 2.5 blocks away. there are a few resturants around but not too many to choose from so that's something to consider if you dont want to go to the city center for each meal! the hotel only serves breakfast but no lunch or dinner. the buffet breakfast is pretty expensive at 17 euros so i didnt try it. there was another option for a package of continental breakfast delivered to your room for 7 euros (juice, fruit yogurt, chocolate bar, a fruit, and a hard broiled egg, a criossant plus jam and butter). there was an espresso maker in the room that made great espressos. The entrace door is 5 stairs above the ground and you have to carry your baggage up to the stairs (no ramps or elevators, etc.). The first thing that i noticed when i entered the lobby: the horrible smell of cigarrates, which was always present both in the lobby and the hallways (even the hallways of non-smoking floors). the receptionist lady was nice and helpful. there was free wireless interent in the lobby but not in all the rooms. i asked to see if they had a room with wireless access and i was told that the rooms on the second floor had wireless, so i asked to be moved to the second floor and after 20 minutes of wait, they gave me a room with wireless access on the second floor. it was worth the wait. my room was facing the main street infront of the hotel and was terribly noisy. i could hear the cars and the tram passing by all evening. also, the doors of the rooms didn't have slam stoppers so each time anyone closed a door, you would hear a big slam, day and night which was very annoying. the bathroom was renovated and nice and clean although very small which was ok for me. the room was clean although the carpet was not new and had some spots on it. there was no iron in the room and i had to ask the reception to give ma an iron and ironing board. there was no fridge or microwave in the room. Not even an alarm clock so i had to request wake-up calls from the reception. So, overall, i would say that the hotel was quite average if it didn't have the noise problems but with all the noise, i have to say that it was a bit below average. There was a shuttle to and from the airport which costed 13.5 each way. to get to the airport from the hotel you could book the shuttle 2 hours before your departure time. it was a very good option. To get to the hotel from the airport, i took a cab to the hotel which costed 35 euros (as i didn't know about the shuttle).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for (nothing more, nothing less)”
Reviews.Author: dcfreqflyer
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 nights at the Park Plaza for about $85 a night, received a discount due to a 4 night stay. The hotel is just south of the beautiful Vondel Park in Amsterdam and is rated as three stars. Hotel has free WIFI in lobby and in small working area near elevators in basement which was convenient although if you went online in the lobby you had to put up with all the smokers. Also, the hotel had one public computer in the lobby for guests use. The room was typically small twin bed in the European style. When we walked in it did have a funky mildew smell to it although it looked nice. the room did have a bathroom and a shower although it was unlike anything I had seen before. The bathroom and shower were enclosed in a frosted glass next to the bed and there was about a 3 foot gap between the top of the glass and ceiling. Nothing horrible, however if you shared the room with someone it is not that private. Didn't eat in the hotel because it was $16 euros for breakfast when you could make a right out of the hotel and go to the bakery a hundred yards down on the opposite side of the street for a much cheaper option. There was a vending machine near the elevators which ahd candy and sodas for $1 euro a piece. Getting around Amsterdam was easy because the #2 tram Emmasraat stop was about 50 yards from the front of the hotel and the museum square area was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The only drawback was that the tram stopped running after midnight however there are night buses that run on the main street just south of the hotel and stop at Emmastraat. Be advised that we were charged a $1.50 euro night-surcharge a person in addition to our regular tram strippenkart to ride the night buses. Overall, the hotel met my expectations for what we paid for. Nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Totally amazing”
Reviews.Author: Claudine Y
Reviews.Content: on our final days of our month long vacation in Europe we booked the Vondel Park Plaza Amsterdam hotel for four nights. We got a great deal through VoyageSNCF.com ( which a highly recomend if you are planning a trip to Europe). The location in perfect, away from all the madness of downtown Amsterdam and close enough that you can take the Tram number 2 or do a 10 minute walk. We got the room 221 which was perfect. Spacious, modern, flat screen tv, the bed super comfortable and the bathroom so big for european standards. To be only a 3 star hotel our room felt like 5 stars. ItÂ´s my favourite hotel in Amsterdam and price vs quality you cannot ask for anything more. Service is cordial and nice. Cleanliness is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and adequate hotel with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: sharry-b4by
Reviews.Content: Before arriving at this hotel I had mixed reviews on reading tips from trip advisor. To be honest it does depend on the kind of person you are and what level of service you know you can deal with. I'm the type of person that cannot deal with unclean and shabby looking places-first impressions really do count. I regard myself as a person who has high expectations, and so do those who know me. I didn't get my sights set too hight on this place due to the different revies but known that i read it was clean, i took the chance and boy was I glad. Set in a great area ten minutes tram ride (TRAM NO 2 which is just ouste the hotel and cost 1 euro 60 ) to and from the center of town know as the great Vondel park-so pretty- you are arms lenght from the hussle and bussle of everybody in town and also have the upside of relaxing in the quieter part of where the hotel is. don't buy breakfast in the holet over priced and tastes of cardboard, there are great places to eat just two tram stops away from hotel _which youcan walk in two mins- and are much more value for money. This hotel's location sold me, the only thing about it was we satyed in one of the rooms(230) which was on the main road side and could hear traffic all day and night long, it is bearable, but hotel really should invest in better glass of sound proofing for windows. overall had great two night stay and returning there again in november for round two of amsterdam!! have a great trip...you will ove it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place overall”
Reviews.Author: Babs67
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend was traveling to Amsterdam for work and the university there booked this hotel for us. We were pleasantly surprised at how large the room was. We also had a large balcony with a wicker table and chairs off the back. The room was outdated, but it appears that they are doing some renovations in the building we were in and perhaps this room has yet to be updated. It was a bit noisy since we were right by the elevator, but the traffic in and out was minimal so the noise was not so much a bother. It is really close to the number 2 tram line which was convenient. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Peace by the Park”
Reviews.Author: FCFrenchay
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just had an enjoyable couple of days in Amsterdam staying at the Vondel Park Plaza. We appreciated its location next to the green, peaceful park. Yes, we had two single beds pushed together and the duvets were unseasonably warm but staff responded promptly and politely to our request for alternative bedding. The room was big enough, quiet and immaculate and the Hot Deal prices were good value. The nearby Film Museum in Vondel Park has friendly restaurant/cafe staff and shows free outside films in the summer - worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: cdld
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one week holiday ... 4 nights in total at the Park Plaza Vondel, Amsterdam (2 nights there, then 3 nights in Brugge, Belgium, then returned for a final 2 nights again at the Park Plaza). Very leary about this hotel after reading all the negative reviews, but then decided to trust our travel agent, and the fact that I think my husband and I are less finicky about our accomodations than some other tourists ... we just wanted clean, comfortable, with modern amenities, and that is what we got. It was also quite a reasonable rate for Amsterdam. Arrived in Amsterdam from Toronto at 6am on a Saturday. We had requested early check-in, and I was very skeptical that we would get, but to our delight, our room was ready. The one thing that did stand out to me was that as we entered the front lobby of the hotel, there was an overwhelming stench of urine, however it must have been dealt with shortly thereafter, because that was the one and only incidence. Based on others' reviews and tales of small, stuffy rooms and poor air circulation, we had also requested a room with AC in the 'new' or 'renovated' part of the hotel, which again, to my surprise, we were granted - and the AC worked wonders. The room itself was TINY! (Rm.526). A double bed pushed in the corner and about 2-3 feet to walk around it on either side. But we were not planning to spend much time there anyway. No complaints about the washroom - small, but not terribly tiny - excellent amenities - modern, clean, good water pressure, good hair dryer and a mirror spanning one entire wall of the washroom. (Girls, the corridors of the hotel have full-length mirrors up and down them as part of the decor, so I would sometimes pop into the hall for that final outfit check!). Mattress was a bit hard (my husband complained about a sore back), but not terrible... we definitely had a number of good night sleeps! Overall, it was better than I was expecting and we were happy to return to the Park Plaza for the final 2 nights of our stay in Amsterdam! Location is good - very quiet, but definitely not central. We had perfect spring weather so we chose to walk a lot, but that is also a great way to explore the city. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseums; 30 minutes to the Leidseplein. The hotel backs onto Vondel Park, so we also got to explore this beautiful, picturesque park. We enjoyed our walks, but it was also easy to jump on the tram (#2) to take you to the Centre. We did this to go to Central Station one day, then made our way back through the city, ie. through the Red Light District, etc. I think I would stick with this location next time, maybe a tad closer to the centre would be nice, but the peace and quiet was just right. A great holiday. Pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireBobbo
Reviews.Content: We needed a break and though that Amsterdam in the spring would do it nicely. We ended up booking the park plaza through expedia after a lot of to and from with booking sites offering unbelieveable deal on the 5* hotels in AMS that were then not available due to 'technical issues'...... Getting there: Having read reviews about the taxis being a ripoff, we decided on using public transport. it took a while to figure out and we eventually made it to the hotel after going via the central station. Despite speaking/reading German it wasn't that obvious how to get there, but various passers by were able to give direction in English. In hindsight, I think I'd just negotiate a deal with a cab at the airport as the trains took at least 90 mins by the time we figured them out and did everything we needed to. By contrast the cab back took 15 mins!!! Location: The hotel itself is in a great part of town, right next to the Vondelpark and in easy walking distance of some top spots for breakfast or if you want to eat on the hoof, theres a beautiful patisserie about 10 mins away (walk 2 tram stops back towards town, turn right and keep going - patisserie is on the right - theres also a launderette and a chemist around there). Its an upmarket area, quiet and clean. Rooms: We got a room the far end of the hotel #351 - that is to say we were in the building furthest from town. "Good enough" would be the summary I'd give them. The bathroom did it's job, towels were clean, shower worked well, even if a bit temperamental about whether to run hot or cold! The hair dryer was a bit puny (girls, bring your own if you want dry hair). The decor was rather..... orange...refurb needed in terms of style but in upkeep it was OK. You get a teeny telly, who cares about TV when you're on holiday though. The mini bar was empty, but again, who cares - you're on hols, go to a bar if you want a drink! One gripe that I share with other reviews is that the beds are singles pushed together so not exactly comfortable if you want to curl up together of a night. The other moan with the beds is a common one in European hotels - the pillows are useless and you only get one. We requested extras (3 times) and got them immediately after snapping at reception on the phone. Service: apart from having to ask several times for extra pillows, they were great. I bought a huge Vanda orchid in the flower market which they put in a safe spot for me when we left our luggage. We were able to borrow umbrellas from them for no charge - just as well since it pee'd down when we were there. Local knowledge was good, directions accurate. nothing to complain about really. General things: Don't bother with the airport shuttle, it didn't show up for us either - we got a cab to take us both back for â‚¬25 so that was a lot better. Not the hotels fault, but worth a mention. Public transport is great in AMS, we went all over the place on the trams and by buying the strip tickets it was a doddle to hop on and off, not that we ever worked out the charging, but at â‚¬6.50 a strip we weren't fussed. Most of the time we just walked around and soaked it all up. The town itself can be a bit confusing to get around so pickup a decent map from somewhere. Coffee shops - actually its not so easy to find one that just sells coffee. Most of them are full of smokers! if thats what you want, you'll be spoiled for choice all over town. If you want a sit down coffee and cake experience, you'll need to keep your eyes peeled a bit more! might seem an odd statement, but thats how we found it. Red Light District: an odd place and well worth a visit even if just to satisfy your curiosity. Keep your guard up, your purse closed and your wallet in tight pockets - you know you're being watched by the pickpockets and 'unsavoury characters'. Night time is most interesting as you can wander through the groups egging each other on, the blind drunk moaning that they wasted â‚¬50 as they couldn't perform and watch the girls working hard to draw in the punters (competition is strong so they'l put on a performance). Canal trips: We did a day one as the heavens opened upon us and wished we'd done the night trip too. Due to where we were in town at the time we ended up on the TUI one right by the main station. there was commentary in english and they tell you a lot of facts. Quite interesting all in all. Crossing the road: Good luck! between trams, "psycholists" as we ended up naming them, and cars, crossing the road is a lottery. The bikes were the worst as you don't hear them coming - stop, look, listen! Diamonds: Interesting to visit the diamond workers/show, but don't buy from them. You're paying extra for the nice show they put on for the hundreds of others who don't buy anything. Gassan was the most interesting and they show you some stunning stones. We were shown a â‚¬92,000 2carat rock and even I, who is not jewellery minded was drawn to it. They offer a shuttle bus service and the reception in the hotel will hand you a leaflet Enjoy amsterdam, its a very cool city :o)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room”
Reviews.Author: passwordprotected
Reviews.Content: Our room was small and incredibly dated. Think early 1990's formica. Chipped paint and peeling wallpaper. The bathroom had tiles missing, the trouser press didn't work and the mini bar was empty, just as well as it had frozen solid. Being English we took our own Tea bags for our morning brew but these we taken away by the chambermaid. We did complain and it took 2 days for replacements to be found. I had to call out a Doctor. Reception arranged this and told be there would be a 40 euro call out fee. It was 100 Euros! Finally we booked the shuttle bus to take us to the airport via reception. Dispite confirming our booking earlier in the day the bus failed to show .. We had to 'get a cab. which was much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: FRANCE02
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. Just some meters (aprox 50m) of the tramway stop that takes you to downtown. It is easy to move from one place to another. In general people at the front desk were nice. The room was clean and no noice. For us it was fine, because we used it just to sleep and all day long visit to the city. We like it very much.

Reviews.Title: “very disappoited”
Reviews.Author: poobum
Reviews.Content: We booked a four night stay in a superior room, with double bed. When we arrived we were shown into a very small claustrophobic room which had twin beds.When we complained about the beds we were shown a room with a double bed and again it was claustrophobic, about 3 metres by 3.5 metres and the bed was against the wall. The room was in the roof space and the ceiling slopped over the bed which didn't help. We were not happy with this but no other rooms were available that night but staff agreed to show us another room the next day. We were ultimately shown a business suite which involved us 'upgrading' but due to inconvenience caused we were not charged the full amout for it. This room was comfortable. The glass walls to the bathroom can be off putting. The hotel is about 15-20 minutes walk into the centre but is near to a tram stop. Coffee shops/bars while walking into town are very good and staff very helpful. Despite a good outcome to our situation though, we would not book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location, only downside is the beds”
Reviews.Author: bmkcam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Vondel Park Plaza from Dec 25-28, 2006. Upon arrival, the customer service, while attempting to be helpful, had a very curt mannerism. Despite this, we were told that we had been "upgraded" to the "residential building" which is right next door to the hotel. This turned out to be a pleasant suprise... Rooms: The room was very nice. The only American channel provided on the TV was MTV, but you don't go to Amsterdam to sit in front of the TV. Unfortunately, the double bed is just two twin beds pushed together (as others have mentioned). While we encountered this in other hotels, Vondel Park Plaza seemed to be a little worse because for some reason the bed was more mobile than the others, and the twin beds were easily seperated. This was the first time that my husband had to wake up in the middle of the night to push the beds back together. The bathrooom was also very nice with a seperate tub and shower. However, the outlet in the bathroom was not able to support the adapter so we ended up having to use the desk outlets so we could place a book underneath the adapter to support the weight. So for all you curling iron users - be prepared to curl your hair at the desk without a mirror! We stayed in Room #1 in the residential building and it is a nice room - definitely recommended. Location: Vondel Park Plaza is in a quiet, safe residential area. The tram stop "Emmastraat" is a five minute walk from the hotel and runs from about 5am-1245am. It costs about 1.60 euro each way per a person to get to city center. The Van Gogh museum and Richt Museum are within walking distance (about 15 mins). Also: There is a bar/resteraunt with a lounge and fireplace near the reception desk. There is one computer with free internet for use BUT it is stone aged and very slow. Despite some nusances - I recommend this hotel because it is a nice location (I would not stay right in city center) and a good value. Tips on Amsterdam: Anne Frank house and Van Gogh museum is a must see! The canal rides are lovely (8 euros/pp) - but make sure you do a night one. My husband and I did it during the day and we both concluded that it would have been more lovely at night. Amsterdam was rather cold in the winter time and I would not visit during December-January.

Reviews.Title: “A rather un-memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: Gluhwein
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline. It seems nothing in Amsterdam is cheap and after months of trying to lowball Priceline for a 4-5 star hotel, I finally upped my bid price and dropped a level in quality which is how I ended-up with 4 rooms at the Vondel Park Plaza. Part of my disappointment is due to my own stupidity, aka cheapness, in deciding to haul our suitcases from Schiphol to Central Station via the train. From there we had to wrestle or bags over cobblestones and tram tracks to catch the #2 tram which took us eventually to within just a few feet of the hotel. Neither the train nor the tram are conducive to this type of activity - nowhere to safely put your bags so you're stuck standing next to them the whole way. It was another hassle dragging the bags up 7-8 steps (no handicap ramp) to the hotel entrance. Inside, the lobby is rather small but clean and comfortable. The staff was very professional and helpful. In fact , even though it was only 10:30 am when we showed-up, we were given rooms. And we were assured that even if the rooms hadn't been ready, the hotel would let us leave our bags while we spent the rest of the day sightseeing. The rooms were on the 4th floor but two elevators made access easy. The rooms were on the quiet back side of the hotel, overlooking the park. The rooms themselves weren't anything special, and were actually rather small. But they were clean and in good repair. My single bed wasn't as firm as I would like nor was the comforter anywhere near as plush as most, but I still ended-up well-rested. The bathrooms were small, but the plumbing worked well with plenty of hot water and strong shower flow. I might have called this hotel above average had they thrown in a free breakfst, or if it were closer to the Damrak area or if the rooms were spectacular. I found nothing particularly wrong with the place but two years ago I paid $20 a night less for rooms at the Amsterdam Renaissance which was an infinitely classier establishment. Based on what was available to us this year the Vondel Park Plaza was about as good as we could expect, but when I go on holiday I expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColCol21
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 day break in Amsterdam. Stayed at the VondelPark Plaza. I cant say anything bad about this hotel, rooms were clean, towels changed everyday(if needed), room was comfortable and had TV. My only reservation at first was the Glass door for the bathroom, but as a couple staying here this wasn't really a problem. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel, went to nearby Leidisplein for this where you will find a plentiful supply of restaurants and bars. Tram is only 2 minutes walk from hotel and will take you through Leidisplein and all stops past Dam Square to the Central Station. I would advise getting the'STRIP' pass for the trams, well worth the money(you can purchase this at the ticket office across from the Central Station for around 11 Euros)I have to admit that we walked almost everywhere without a problem, just watchout for the Bike riders, they take no prisoners. I would recomend visiting the Anne franks house, well worth the 7.50 euros. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: mgcasvtiany
Reviews.Content: This place is right on the tram line so its easy enough to get into central Amsterdam after a 10 minute ride. The rooms were a bit cramped, but overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet area but easy access to all sights”
Reviews.Author: Robert07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family with two adjacent rooms. Our double was quite roomy with the glass walled bathroom which other reviewers have commented about. Personally we found it fine. The childrens' room though was definitely on the small side and the storage area was difficult to use. Perhaps this variation in rooms accounts for the differing reviews which this hotel gets. The hotel is situated in a residential area next to the Vondelpark (lovely for a stroll but mind the bikes!) but only a few yards from a tram stop which whisks you quickly into the city centre. The staff were just about acceptable but were neither particularly swift or efficient at the front desk. Avoid the breakfast at all costs unless it is included in your room rate as it is not worth the money. They stopped replenishing the buffet half an hour before it was due to close so late comers went away empty handed. The quality was mediocre and dining room service poor with uncleared tables everywhere. We paid Â£100 per room which was not cheap but it was high season. I have stayed here previously out of season for under Â£70. The breakfast was an unfortunate blot on what was otherwise a very pleasant stay and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ZoeMac
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews we had read but was very disappointed with what we found. We booked two superior rooms, paying the same price for each. I was in a couple and given a room just big enough to house a double bed. Our single travelling companion was given a single room with about two feet square of floor space and a shower that flooded the whole room when used. We complained immediately to the reception staff but they were very unhelpful saying that the hotel was fully booked and there was no duty manager we were able to speak to. The next day we did get through to the manager who changed our rooms for two descent sized doubles but they were filthy. The bath was full of hair and there were nail clippings on the carpet! One of the rooms did not have bedding and when it did arrive we were handed the duvet and covers separately and left to get on with making it ourselves. On the plus side the hotel is located in a nice area of Amsterdam and the park behind the hotel is lovely to walk through towards the centre. The hotel is due to close for (much needed) refurbishment in November and I got the distinct feeling that the staff had lost interest in doing their jobs properly until then. I certainly would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: JOTB
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I took a trip to Europe in August of 2005. We spent time in London & Essex England/ Paris, France and Amsterdam, Netherlands. I fell quite ill a the beginning of our stay in England and from that got quite home sick. But Amsterdam was truly fabulous. I felt 99% better when we were there and this hotel really took a lot of the culture shock away. It was certainly modern and more of what I am used to as far a hotel rooms go. We had a very large spacious room. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The tram was steps away to Dam Square. There was a pub up the street, and the neighborhood was gorgeous. If we are ever in Amsterdam again, I will definitely stay here. The only complaint I had was that the people that were in the room before us clearly smoked, which plugged both my fiancÃ© and I up pretty good.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Plaza Vondelpark, Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Koninginneweg 34-36, Amsterdam 1075 CZ, The Netherlands
